DLE6Zjua-SlRQczjBsR-DA.text: Great food, it's not very big, so seating is limited. Some have complained about the reservation system pre paying + tip for a portion of their meal. I was shocked the first time I made a reservation too, but seeing that our bill (without drinks) is usually around $25 - $30 per person I don't have a problem pre paying. Not being a large restaurant if a few groups don't show for up for their reservations that affects larger percentage of tables and other possible customers. If I'm able to make a reservation because others who wouldn't show up for their's don't make one, then I'm happy.

g9JXfL6FtF08Vu85ntaxGQ.text: This place is top notch. Every dish I have ordered is great. Beet ravioli, mushroom sandwich, shrimp appetizer, free cookie dough at the end. Place is low key. Next door good for breakfast as well

sGRFiUWuh8_k1C7p6L_1nw.text: Nice little place. I love the location. The parking wasn't the best. You have to park across the street. My car is slammed to the floor and I cannot make it up the driveway across the street. So I parked in the street. As soon as I walked in I was not greeted I was told, by who must have been the manager, I should have parked somewhere else. Which really didn't make me feel too happy. The food was great. The server was teally busy but that's understandable. The food was great we had the pasta nachos. They were really good. While we were finishing up we noticed our sever had asked the people next to us to leave due to other people waiting to be seated. Which surprised me. I wouldn't think that's top notch service. The space is very limited. It can maybe hold 30 people at a time. Had it not been for the experience from the staff it would be a 5 star review.

BP8czhFobmxUH3hBZU97bw.text: Very randomly ended up at Tuck Shop and so happy I did.  They have some great drink special ALL night long, not just happy hour times - made a mean Dark N Stormy.... yummy!  Its just the cutest, classiest, coziest, most welcoming establishment.  Makes you feel like you could spend hours upon hours there.  Our waiter/bartender was fantastic and I wish I caught his name.  The bar was full so we sat in the 'reading room' .... couches and chairs sectioned off from the bar and restaurant by bookshelves.    Although we were not there to eat, the entire place smelled SO GOOD and the food looked wonderful.  I can't wait to go back there for dinner!

2yjShsBAIqUN4NZ2UuQH8A.text: Sadly I'm going to rate this restaurant based on my recollection of Homemade Ginger Ale and Fried Cheese Curds... maybe I should stop now... Hmm.    Location, Food, Ambience - neat little place.  I eat at plenty of places but rarely two months later can a recall anything specifically about the experience, but Tuck Shop had fried cheese curds... really good fried cheese curds - I was in Wisconsin for a while so I've had my share, and these were probably the best I've had - usually you just end up with a fried cheese stick but here they did the cheese curd justice - and then you get some tasty home brewed ginger ale to wash it down...  Yeah, Ginger Ale and Fried Cheese Curds...  Hmm, I probably shouldn't have written this...

7E6tsqfTJbkfqvVHVTVlaw.text: The difference between 4 and 5 stars, in my opinion, is the little things that make a restaurant just over the top. Tuck Shop has that, in spades.   We've been meaning to try the place since we saw it on some TV show last summer, and finally on a random Saturday night took the plunge.  At 6:15 the place was already packed, with a 45 minute wait for a table for two. Luckily, the host (John, I believe the owner?) suggested sitting at the  bar, which was open. The bar has nifty hooks for a lady's purse right under the counter (so the purse doesn't touch the floor) which made my wife smile.  Laura, the bartender, immediately made sure we felt very much at home with a friendly and very attentive attitude as we ordered, easily answering the questions of all the bar patrons.  My wife's smile got a lot larger as we ordered non-alcoholic drinks: I had iced tea (the Republic of Tea's darjeeling in a bottle, but only $3) and she had Ginger Ale: house-made from real ginger, with tonic water and lime. It was FANTASTIC, wow!  Based on the TV show, we first had the beer-battered cheese curds, which were quite tasty - peppery with a great light cheese flavor, and just enough for a taste for both of us for $4.  We then ordered two items off the "smaller plates" portion of the menu  -- think of them as appetizers. They are a bit pricy ($9 each) but two of them would make a nice little meal.   First was the stuffed mejool dates with chorizo. I would never have thought of the combination, but they were truly delicious! Served on a bed of arugula that had a great lemon tang, the arugulu really added to the flavor of the dates instead of just being a throw-away bed of greens.  Next was another TV Show mention, the Times Mac & Cheese. Very very good! A bit of spice and good high-end cheese choices made my wife's smile grow into tasty little yummy noises.  By now, we knew we'd be back.  We then decided to split a main course (the menu calls them "for sharing" but I'd call it a single person entree, in the $20 range): the pork chop with kugel (noodles) and salsa verde. The chop was perfectly cooked, and the salsa verde was clearly homemade and very very good. I'd have liked a bit more of the salsa and less of the sour cream, but thats really personal taste. The kugel was an interesting side and was good.  Finally, we decided to split the peach cobbler for desert. As you'll probably expect by now, it was excellent, with a nice cinnamon flavor with tasty homemade whipped cream and biscuit.  All in all, a fabulous meal for a decent price: Laura the bartender helped make this a great meal we've already talked to friends about going back!

z6bcsxCOd6oJzmUG_FiMGw.text: Very tasty food with a great atmosphere. A bit on the pricey side but worth the splurge. It's a great addition to the Coronado neighborhood!

ywFwcOHtLzE3Ze8dDMQpvw.text: We celebrated  my daughter birthday , we were promptly seated. Waitress was attentive at first . Our appetizers were mixed up the second order came 15 minutes late with no excuses the food was tasty, a little salty  .Our party liked the mac and  cheese however three persons were sick after  , portions were a little small

glqMrVxWKzwSG3fmh7kr-A.text: **for whatever's it's worth here's my very old, unfinished...Tuck Shop Review:   After several loopy-de-loops and a quick text to Google Find, our little group of three happily found the charming neighborhood Tuck Shop, last night after the Luna Festival.   This is a place where you can go and feel welcomed and familiar. A place where the food is not over-seasoned and the service is friendly and attentive. While the atmosphere, music, low light and cool mini art gallery makes you relaxed...the food service was prompt.   At Tuck Shop, they've embraced the sharing concept, which is what probably excited my companions the most. I am one that normally does not enjoy sharing my food in equal portions...you may have a bite, but the rest is all mine!   Although we did not sit at the bar, we appreciated the detail of purse hooks under the counter. And noted both the casual choice of miscellaneous dining chairs ....   (**please note, this review was started in march of 2009...prior to finding out I was pregnant. Needless to say, I forgot all about this review in progress and now may 2011, it's been so long since I ate here, that I can't even remember what exactly we ate. But, I definitely remember I enjoyed the food, whatever it was! ...loved the vibe of the place and I'd love to venture back to phoenix just to try it again, so that I can give a proper review and see if it can keep it's 4 stars from me.)

ZkGKSetJ6HsX4byr-VdcmQ.text: The most comfortable atmosphere I have ever experienced. The host/manager was very welcoming, one of the few places where I did not mind waiting for a table. We relaxed with drinks in the "living room". Food was good, cheese curds and Vivian Wards were a favorite of the table.   My boyfriends pork was overcooked and they handled it well and quickly. Everyone was very friendly and the service was good.

eYskaVrjEqw5tHk9Bj011A.text: This restaurant has the best food I have ever eaten.  Great atmosphere, great serves.  Five stars all the way

ZuRJOgYyZp1TC2ik2jWnbg.text: We went to Tuck Shop the other night and wowser! The food is fricking delicious. So we started with the chicory salad, which was amazing. I am still day dreaming about the roasted hazelnuts and squash. We then devoured the dates stuffed with chorizo and cheese. It tastes exactly what it sounds like and it goes so well together. On to the larger sharing plate of chicken and waffles . . . this was simply heavenly. The meat of the chicken was so juicy and tender and the nice hue of rosemary and citrus was just perfect. The cheddar infused waffle was light and fluffy and gave the crust of the waffle a nice cheesy taste. The best part was the maple gravy-like syrup, which was something I have never experienced. Both of us were in silence and trying to savor every bite.   I forgot to mention the fabulous drink specials Tuesday through Thursdays. I knew the moment I saw all their mixed drinks with ginger ale that I was going to love this place. I could have drank spiced rum and ginger ale and the "dark and stormy" all night.   I love the idea of sharing plates because you get a variety without getting uncomfortably full. I wish a lot more restaurants had this concept. The ambiance was simple and cute with each table having purposeful mismatched chairs. My partner noticed that the seats of all the chairs were the same, which was a very smart design for equality of comfort. Tuck Shop you get all 5 stars for taste, selection, and ambiance.

oxYHCF1EcPzbk0Qto7Bjmw.text: My husband and I are just moving to the Coronado Historic District in Phoenix and we couldn't be happier to have found this lovely and charming restaurant.  Having  lived in other areas of the valley it was refreshing, real, and unpretentious, with food that is oh so good!! The chicken and waffles did not disappoint and melted in our mouths and the chocolate pumpkin cake was the perfect ending of deliciousness. The staff is so warm and inviting and we can't wait to come back when we officially move next month.

aOd47wM_Z6aI10uorH3Omg.text: Really liked their ale. For appetizers I tried out pasta fries which had good dipping sauce but pasta fries where so so. Then I had chicken and waffles... Good waffles (sweet and buttery), god green beans....then an ok chicken. Really liked the interiorand its  cleanliness and service. Would come back to try other dishes.

U5IOO4jnJo7rxFr4WJ0nuw.text: They only reason I give the place 4 instead of 5 is because we made a reservation the day before so we wouldnt have the 45 minute Friday night wait and when my group showed up...surprise...our reservation wasn't saved because they don't do reservations for less than 6 people (confusing because thats not what the person said who took our reservation the day before).  Even with the wait though, we all seemed to enjoy ourselves. We started with the "lobstah" mac & cheese and some brie sandwiches to kick it off. Then we also ordered Vovo's favorite which changes daily and were pleasantly surprised with the ribs and potatoes. However the best part of our meal were the chicken and waffles, sooooo delicious!! I will definitely come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Vovo&#39;s favorite, chicken &amp; waffles, and lobstah mac&amp;cheese

PjS0gPUGqOmj8elR0vXjTQ.text: A++ for service - friendly without being pushy, well-mannered without being pretentious. Our guy Craig was awesome and we are high maintenance the first time we try a place!  What a saint.   A+ for the heavenly "slightly dirty" martini that came out perfectly as smooth as silk.  Knocked it out of the park on the menu selections.  Every item we ordered delivered 100% for flavor, presentation and freshness.  We LOVED the cheese curds, smooth creamy and just a hint of the batter flavor to round things out NO dipping necessary, they are perfect just the way God made 'em.   Red Beans & Rice was Spousal Unit's favorite - the smoke from the sausage and the zesty sauce in the dish had so much personality, adding grilled shrimp perfectly done was a bonus.  Trust me he has eaten that dish EVERYWHERE and this one got a standing ovation!    GO, GO NOW and support this local eatery.  This is the perfect Date Night Location!

KTsX_jgJWK765BtzCwgcnA.text: Honestly, i was skeptical, everything that has such a buzz is usually disappointing.  The food was all great.. prices were reasonable.  Most importantly the service was excellent. # of us ate communal style and one out of 5 dishes were super salty.   The runner took the plate (almost full) away without asking if there was something wrong with it, the server didn't notice due to the busy night.  I felt compelled to say something since i usually don't.  After telling the server he took the initiative to tell the "boss" , they immediately comped it.  I was so surprised since something so "common sense seems to be not so common in this city.  Of course we over tipped the amount of the comp.  J  I am a fan.  The space itself looks awesome.  All I can suggest is they reposition the entrance... maybe that huge window diagonal from it since you walk right in to an uncomfortable place.   But they are expanding... so lets see what happens.

aHMRRYVgHWAsVsmroqcUBA.text: Great prices and great food! Loved the menu selections and the small plates that allowed us to try many different plates. The chili and mac and cheese was amazing! Really enjoyed the service and happy hour menu was awesome as well.   Cool ambiance and the service was great as well. Their drink selection is quite different as well which was awesome to get a little different tastes throughout the meal.   Would go here much more often if I lived closer!

dmt3o9q13SB5n-OVwsA2iA.text: I went with friends who have been before and love this place... I was unimpressed.  I tried the crab pot, pasta fries, dates, Mac/cheese and chicken n waffles.  It felt like the chef was trying to get too many flavors on each plate, regardless of whether or not they complimented each other.  Nothing excited me but the crab pot had some pickled watermelon accompaniment that was pretty good and interesting.

T_xP7INOW49XfyBSth4XFg.text: The baguette is delicious, it comes with garlic that spreads like butter. Service is above average. The ambiance with the tea light candles on the table was romantic. I ordered Mac n cheese with lobstah. It is to die for. Full of creamy goodness. It filled me up, best I've had in years. Everything was top notch. My date had the best lobster bisque ever. $41 bucks for the best meal I've had in years.

3xej8-t1vofZ1keNWb3GJw.text: Such a nice balance between comfortable and formal. A great place for a first date, or to take a loved one out somewhere nice, yet warm and welcoming. The food is really something else; really well done. It's like fancy comfort food. Just an all around great place to spend some time. You'll be spending anywhere between 65 - 120 including tip, depending on how many drinks you order.

rlR1pWqTyJBbky3M2y0vxA.text: Probably the best restaurant in all of Arizona.  I can't say this for a fact because I haven't eaten at every single restaurant in this state but I have only had great experiences here.  This place changed ownership about 8 months ago and it went from being really good to extremely awesome. So thanks to the new owners and staff for taking it to the next level. Service is always, ambiance is suitable for groups or a date and I recommend the chicken and waffles.

xrfahyFVBW_glZyJvNDypg.text: at his place is fantastic. I arrived early for Sunday Brunch.  I was greeted when I walked in the door and was told I could wait for my party at the bar or in the large, and very comfortable looking, living room area. I decided to wait at the bar.  The bar tender introduced herself as Grace and told me she was one of the owners.  I wasn't feeling a traditional Mimosa so she asked me a few questions about what I liked and she made me the most awesome cocktail.   When my party arrived we were seated promptly.  The server was very good at suggesting shared plates for the group.  Since there were 5 of us we opted for the French Toast plate that came with 5 pieces of French Toast with an apple compote and whipped cream.  It was delicious.  Everyone ordered a Brunch item off the menu.  I had the Chicken and Waffles that consisted of 3 big, well seasoned, pieces of chicken with a somewhat savory waffle and eggs.  It was a lot of food, but, I loved it.  Others ordered the Crab Benedict which they said was also very good.    The food was very impressive,the cocktails were great, the service was outstanding, the restaurant was cozy.  I have nothing bad to say about this restaurant.  I would highly recommend it.

qZnjqqlb2458HIJlKHRLMA.text: Outstanding!!! Where do I start? Ambiance is wonderful and quaint. Service is phenomenal, I believe our servers name was Linda, she was kick ass, didn't miss a beep! We were a party of 12 and every one was blown away from the cocktails to the appetizers, all the way to the home made bread pudding for dessert. This hole in the wall is a secret treasure and we will definitely be back again. Oh! And the wine selection was unbelievably fairly priced for such a great selection. When you go in make sure you ask grace for a recommendation. Tuck shop, keep up the great work!!

e8dEU4UH5mgDZwMlkE81DA.text: I don't like to give 5 stars, but this place deserves it.  Every dish was fantastic, starting with cheese curds that were a perfect mix of sweet and salty and chorizo stuffed dates, which paired amazingly well.  For entrees I got the chicken and waffles - the cheddar waffle tasted more like a cheese biscuit than a waffle, but it was a worthy partner to the crispy fried thigh, leg and breast that came with the meal.  Where do they find breasts this big?  The breading was so crunchy you could literally knock on it. My wife got the pork loin which was super flavorful and came with some bomb bacon jam.  And both dishes were accompanied with some excellent charred veggies.  Finally, we finished with an amazing bread pudding that had an intense whiskey flavor.  I don't think there was any sugar in the cream, so you could stir it into the sauce and get exactly the right flavor to your own taste.  Definitely a winner and going back.

HSLGXylvE0eVAh-6WB-L9A.text: One of fave restaurants in Phoenix. A total hidden gem. Owned by a fabulous couple who exude warmth and joy, which they've translated into the atmosphere of this lovely restaurant. The food is simply delicious. I've had the tacos, the rack of lamb, the shop salad, and the pork belly so far... all of them leaving my tummy and mouth smiling. Last time I went I smelled the ribs...getting those next! They have creative cocktails and a wonderful wine list. Fine dining at a reasonable price and beautiful locale.

v8tWLhZ1OJFnjzLupC2GyQ.text: I went to dinner here last night with my bf. We have lived in Phoenix for over a year now and had only heard about this place 2 days ago. Needless to say that when a fellow foodie tells you about a great place, you go there the next night.  We started with the cheese curds and the grilled baguette with the roasted garlic & olive oil. The curds were salty and savory while the bread with roasted garlic was subtle but delicious. I ended up combining both appetizers (putting the cheese on top of the garlic spread with the bread) and it made it perfect: salty, garlicky, and wonderful.  My bf had the Pine AZ spiced steak with mashed potatoes. He let me have a bite of each and the steak was tender, juicy, and flavorful. The potatoes were creamy but lacked depth in my opinion.   I had the Beet Crudo Ravioli and the Gnocchi for my main course. The gnocchi was fluffy with a delicate outer crunch; the cheese sauce it came with was delicious. Like everything in life, more cheese sauce is appreciated. Now the beet crudo ravioli was on a whole other level. The beets in combination with the cheese filling and the cold gazpacho-like sauce was insanely good. I ate that dish slowly, savoring every bite.   We were planning on ordering the creme brulee for dessert but the owner, Grace, beat us to it and delivered it to us on the house. It was rich and creamy with the lovely sugar crust on top. It was so nice of her to do that and made regular customers out my bf and I.  Honestly, this place is amazing. From the cozy atmosphere to the reasonable prices to the effort that's evidently put into each dish...I don't understand how I, as a foodie, had not heard of it until now. But I'm so glad I did and we'll be back for more!

fN6AbFMLgahsMUxiNsne1g.text: I heard from a friend that this girl from Manchester named Grace owns a splendid restaurant in Phoenix so when I was there I went to check it out.  It's really amazing.  Wonderful food and drink and I was there for about three hours and everyone was so nice and the food was great.  I had the pork shoulder and the tuna tartare and the missus had the chicken and waffles   Delicious!!!

5vazKUhN7PSB5UM4LcB-Xw.text: Cool place with tasty food and good services

Y5GLqyrH-YV3zpoH7km0Jw.text: This place definitely exceeded my expectations. We walked in on a Friday night at about 6:30p with no reservations and was told the entire dining room was booked until 9p. However, we had a choice of the bar or the "living room" with couch style seating. We chose the only two bar seats left.   The menu was very diverse from appetizers to desserts. There is a small plate section that is more tapas style and then a normal entree size section. Although the cheese curds did sound appealing, we chose to start with the zucchini planks and Sonoran pigs-in-a-blanket for our appetizers. Both of which were definitely far better than even the description made them sound. Their specialty cocktails were equally as impressive with hand crafted ingredients that were mixed together perfectly. If you like tequila, the No. 18 is a must try!   For the entree I ordered the filet mignon and it was cooked to perfection with an amazing red wine glaze. It came with frites as a side and a house made truffle aioli. My fiance got the pork tenderloin with bourbon bacon jam and it was also cooked and seasoned perfectly. Although we opted not to get dessert, the bill came with two raw cookie dough balls. That was an absolutely perfect finish for an amazing meal.

rvCTtEtYFhqEMo5KfLn2Zg.text: I want to spend a day and try every single cocktail on the menu, the service is sweet and the atmosphere is trendy cool.

3aDcA6VnHu7k1hq518Hbfw.text: How have I not written a review for one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix yet? Bad Rachel! Tuck Shop is a great spot, tucked away in a neighborhood, and full of delicious seasonal food. They not only have a rotating menu, but an extensive wine list and create their own syrups in-house for cocktails.   Their mac n cheese (WITH LOBSTER OBVIOUSLY) is incredible. Their simple, yet tasty, roasted garlic is always a must with me as well. Salads are top notch, daily specials always mouth watering, and it's just a warm atmosphere to be a part of.   The manager is supremely nice and recognizes you after just one visit. Every waiter I've had has been the picture of great service and I can't think of one bad dish I've been served. Parking can sometimes be a bit tricky, but there is a large lot across the street that you can use. It's a great place to take out-of-towners, a date, or your parents.

cY19T3CGRrcQcYlQylgBrw.text: This place is just perfect. The food is amazing. Stuffed Medjool Dates is worth every dollar and I had one of Vovo's Favorites, which was a fish dishwith mango-like sauce and risotto or polenta or something like that. Whatever it was, it was good. At the very end of the meal, you get a cookie dough ball which is just.. ahhh amazing.  This is my second time being here. I had the chocolate cake at the end last time, and it was so mouthwateringly good. I just didn't get it this time because I ate so much I was almost in pain.   This is a great place for a date night. Ambience is dim lit light and semi-casual.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

JlEVLvMeX1Yl5Z6DrVdk9Q.text: Took another Yelper's advice & tried out Tuck Shop for date night. Absolutely LOVED it! Super trendy, very intimate spot with a unique menu. We shared each dish & still had leftovers to bring home! Definitely recommend making a reservation, seating is very limited.   We started with the Zucchini Planks. (I love anything zucchini!!) They were lightly breaded, flash fried to perfection with a lemon dipping aioli that was fantastic. We shared the Baby Lettuce Salad (sounds boring, but that goddess dressing - yum!!) For our entree, we split the Chicken & Waffles with a small plate of Mac & Cheese. We were totally impressed with the meal. Three HUGE pieces of chicken that were golden fried served with fluffy waffle quarters & string beans. Definitely enough to share. And the Mac & Cheese? Topped with bacon & filled with gooey cheese sauce, it was heavenly.   Prices were on point, the whole meal with drinks for the two of us was under $55. We will definitely be back again... With the daily specials I can't wait to try what's next!

cmUvgual0hjBj0a8t0hgkw.text: Cool place! Myself and a party of 5 came here to celebrate and eat dinner for my sister's Bachelorette party... The food was very good. The service was good, and we enjoyed our time here!

rSPX6sE_Hc2XZ3Mjmi8wyw.text: The restaurant is a nice surprise in the middle of Coronado. You don't really expect something so nice there. They have a lovely full bar that would be nice to sit at and just have a couple drinks. The service was very attentive and great. My beef was with the food. The prices are a little steep but I guess you are paying for the ambience, and the portions are small.   My brother and I had happy hour cocktails, the baguette with roasted garlic, the shrimp piri piri, the surf and turf special, and the banana bread desert. Their happy hour goes from 5-6 and their signature cocktails are $5. I got a tasty bourbon drink and my brother got a (non-happy hour) vodka tonic. They make their own tonic there, which I give them props for, but my brother said it tasted weird and was too sweet for a tonic.   The shrimp was ok. The piri piri was not very flavorful and there were only about 5 small shrimp and an abundance of pita tips. This was more like a small appetizer then a small meal. The roasted garlic with the baguette was good but I can't believe that they charge for bread and call it an appetizer. The surf & turf special was a really fatty ribeye steak with even smaller shrimp on top, soggy yellow rice and french fries. We asked for medium and got very rare (but at least it wasn't over cooked, I guess). If you're paying $30 for a 4-6 ounce steak, the meat to fat ratio should be a little higher and it should be cooked right. The moist and plentiful banana bread desert was probably the best part of the meal.  I went in here really wanting to love this place but I probably would only come back for drinks and desert. To their credit, the restaurant is well decorated and they have great service.

WcFWFDsnQnEwzCUY49oxyQ.text: The tuck shop is a True neighborhood gem! Something that we don't have enough of in Phoenix! The proprietor takes True delight in serving her clientele. The atmosphere is warm and relaxing.  The food is delicious, fresh and interesting.  You can not go wrong with a trip or multiple trips to the tuck shop.

5_MGX74TVgRubBdV-N2BtQ.text: Adorable restaurant with lovely ambience, delicious menu and FANTASTIC service. Our server (I am so sorry, I forgot your name but you had fabulous turquoise nails!) recommended the shop salad and the beet ravioli and both were to die for! We had a lovely date night and will definitely be back!

oU1s8Hgo7E-6xQ3x59fLVA.text: A awesome shop!  I got the information of Tuck Shop from my friend. She highly recommended me to have a try. I was so satisfied with the food there, and the service was good enough.

tphhZUHD88L2_0BqdQRIkQ.text: This place is super cute! I had an IPA and the Mac and Cheese and it was delicious! The restaurant itself is cute and lively nestled in the historic Coronado neighborhood. Would make a cute date spot, or just a place to sit at the bar or read on the couches. Will definitely return!

ep47u96sSidRByJvIKiy6w.text: This place is awesome.  It is truly one of the best restaurants I have ever been to.  The atmosphere is so inviting; it is almost like home.  There is even a little waiting area that feels like a living room.  The service was outstanding, friendly, accommodating, polite, and not at all stuffy.  The whole thing has a very modern feel to it right down to the food, which consists of small and larger (sharable) plates.  The food is just fantastic.  I recommend the following:  Cheese Curds: a light snack to start off and they are AMAZING. Brussels Sprouts: I don't like Brussels sprouts but I like these Brussels sprouts. Shrimp Po-Boys: Fantastic Chicken& Waffles: LoLo's it is not but the fried chicken is delicious.  It's more of a Italian style than a southern one: light and crisp, not battered and fatty, but delicious for sure. Lamb Meatballs: Really exceptional; don't pass these up  I wasn't as blown away by the mac and cheese as others seem to be.  Maybe this is worth a try though but it wasn't my thing.  The drinks are also excellent.  All of them are thoroughly homemade.  They make one of the best Dark & Stormy's ever.  GO NOW!

k34waFTcl4KzLyCN2MnPMA.text: LOVE. This is a must in Phoenix. Reminded me of CA cuisine with the use of fresh vegetables and ambiance.  Pros:  -great use of space, love the architecture here.  -comfy sofas to lounge in for pre-dinner cocktails. Reminded me of being in a living room. -GREAT cocktails and HH specials. They do their own mixes. Dark & Stormy was great. -delicious salmon special. If they have it (it's seasonal), you must order. -was told their fried chicken is amazing but haven't tried, you might want to check it out  Cons:  -possibly long wait on weekends and during prime dinner time  Verdict:  -Go, go, go. This is an amazing hidden gem in Phoenix.

nltrpdjTKloKfQP8vTXfjw.text: This place is unbelievably amazing! I went with a group of GF's and we all had a great time. My tip is go with people who like to share. We ordered a bunch of stuff and shared everything.   From the cute and cozy atmosphere to the amazing and creative food! This is a must go to restaurant!   Everything we ordered was delicious!   The Chicken & Waffles are just as good as everyone raves about -MUST TRY!  The Cheese Curds melt in your mouth!  The Skirt Steak is very tender and well-seasoned The Chorizo Dates- YUMMMM, anything stuffed with Schreiner's sausage is AMAZING We tried both the brownie & pineapple upside down cake- Definitely go with the brownie if you like chocolate!  I can't wait to go back

E7ge6HNNtyaW0uoTd2yieA.text: Loved the ahi tartare.   British and Australian influence. Off the charts seasonal drink menu. Lee and grace are awesome

X-DnEnUPkuXB0OH8M77SPA.text: Went on a Friday night around 7 pm without a reservation and was told that it would be about a 45 minute wait.  They directed us next door to Astor House where we could have some drinks and appetizers, so that's what we did.  There, we ordered the gumbo appetizer, which turned out to be the size of a full-on entree for two.  That filled us up, but after waiting for all that time for a table at Tuck Shop we were reluctant to just leave it at that, thus more eating ensued once we finally got a table.  We ordered the salmon hand pie, which was good but not great.  I also wanted to try to stuffed medjool dates which I heard a lot about here on yelp, but was left disappointed.  My boyfriend ordered the skirt steak which was delicious.  Luckily we didn't order dessert because we got one for free when we got our check.  Overall, I had higher expectations but I still enjoyed our dining experience so I might come again.

4f1HwXteQRcr0UqmUCl5DQ.text: Two words: cheese curds. The house made ginger ale, house made tonic water are Both to die for. Excellent cocktails and delicious food. Everything we tried was cooked to perfection.

t3-g8Xkt6nh4dZmY-QYXZw.text: Where do I start.  Well for one the atmosphere is very cozy, trendy and hip.  It was the perfect place to relax and connect with my friend.  The staff was so friendly, kind, and attentive.  I don't think my water got below half a glass before someone filled it up, and I drink A LOT of water.  The food was like heaven, it was perfect in every way.  If you don't choose this restaurant, you are truly missing out!  A MUST in Phoenix!

_142swdanZItqIiIzreQbQ.text: I was in Phoenix visiting friends and they took me to this wonderful place called Tuck Shop.  It is located in a up and coming neighborhood across from the musicians union and the restaurant itself is so inviting.  Our bartender Emily was really sweet and so was Grace the owner. We had a lot of different dishes and everything on the menu was superb. Also the wine list is incredible as our the cocktails.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town. Outstanding.

jqhcl4GTXjBJgiP5K50voQ.text: Tuck-ed away in a neighborhood, this is a small gem. The atmosphere is cozy and it's intimate without being too personal. Lots of hip foodies here. And lots of yummy cocktails too.  The most memorable dish for me was the chorizo dates. So good. So fun to split tapas-style items with my date that night. I'll be back!

AgBsqnU9VHuEQySX5bSxiQ.text: Great neighborhood place! Staff are super friendly, good vibes. GET THE CHEESE CURDS! They're heaven in your mouth...

ZiRbQJppPk695yoTIV-MUA.text: Cheese curds, Dude salad, and Chicken and waffles were our chosen items tonight. All three were delicious! Atmosphere is awesome. You'd almost miss the place in the dark. Our only complaints were the cheese curds could have used dipping sauce and the skin of the fried chicken was too crispy. The waffles were my favorite.  They were made with white cheddar. Scrumptious, highly recommended.

38c112328rA0nUUqzKpfpw.text: Tried their food at Devour a few years ago and just made it in last weekend. It was a great experience and I'm looking forward to my next trip there.

Wc4_14Z324q_j8oVterbbA.text: The Chicken & Waffles with the green beans were absolutely delicious! Max was an engaging bartender who provided great conversation for this quaint spot. Highly recommend.

eyR0eDNCL5Z4VuGX57uC_Q.text: I was there after work last week and had great service. Excellent selection both food and beer and will return again. Staff and manager pleasant and nice. Thanks for good time

9_GEQKsmOV_B7ExpPsIeEQ.text: This amazing gem in my neighborhood never disappoints.  The new menu is awesome!  We had to do the cheese curds, always a favorite...and the new pigs in a blanket with Schreiner's sausage.  OMG.  Entrees - I often gravitate back to the chicken and waffles.  SO good.  Hubs had the BBQ ribs and he cleaned his plate!  The four of us had two bottles of Simple Life Pinot Noir, another standby.  Little cookie dough bites still there for a sweet treat since we had no room for dessert....though they sounded heavenly!  Love that we can make reservations now.  Thanks John and crew for another great meal!!

46_wwsVr2X4Jy75ah6ntag.text: Went based on the reviews, and was somewhat underwhelmed.  Good, but just good.  Tried several items the waiter recommended, and nothing really "popped".

UOtZPrDr8O_4O6aE476V-w.text: Had a delicious pork loin accompanied by onion rings and braised radicchio.  Pork was cooked perfectly and generously portioned.  I had to add salt to the onion rings, but not because they were bland, just because I like them extra salty.  Sat at the bar, enjoyed the warm and inviting decor.

zr7LiuOxJslyLdmeKEqk4w.text: The food is amazing.  So naturally the place can get packed.  This is by far the best place to go for a late weekday night date night.  The atmosphere is classy and unique, but during any peak hours it will be crazy busy, cramped and loud, but still well worth it.  THE FOOD is EXCELLENT!!  The servers are all very cool and fun to talk to.  This place is a must, but for the best experiance stay away during common dinning hours.

oL16M7M6E4reNdkRMKouXg.text: I truly enjoyed my entire experience at this little gem. Awesome food, awesome service & awesome ambience. It is not often that I walk away from a restaurant feeling completely and totally satisfied, but this time I did! Looking forward to going back again soon!

np7yzaajSPvft_onutlVgg.text: This place is a real hidden gem! In fact if you are distracted you will miss it over and over. A really TINY place and usually gets very busy.   We were a group of 6 that because of the change in time with our reservation, some had to cancel. The unpleasant part (and the missing star) is that the owner will stare at us every time as if it was our fault. To enjoy better this place DON'T go with a group larger than 4.   We had the fried noodles and yes, the salsas are worth trying. The bread with garlic is something I wouldn't order for it's price, but my friend enjoyed it. I shared a chicken and waffle with one of my friends and gladly this portion was more than enough. I wouldn't fry that chicken. It is cooked in a good way and the meet is really tasty, the breeding comes like a crust and it becomes too much.   The other dish that was tried is the mac & cheese. I really can't understand who orders this in a restaurant. My friend was a bit disappointed as he was dreaming of crispy prosciutto (never heard about this) and for him it was too tender.    We also tried the rum and ginger ale, YES! try it! If there is a next time, I'll make sure I don't have a reservation so we can eat and enjoy our dinner.

NkQBA1lWKDMIiFKLp-Tr3g.text: Pro: nice atmosphere; attentive server Con: The tacos were pricey considering you get three street tacos (tiny). The portabella melt is served on generic wheat bread (think Nature's Own or something like you would get at the grocery store.) The side of quinoa/rice salad was overwhelmed by the taste of red onion to the point that I could not eat it. The portabella had great flavor but I wish there had been more it. The cantaloupe with salt and a drizzle of olive oil was surprisingly good.  Was the food bad? Overall, no. However, I left hungry and not feeling like it was worth the $45 we paid (with tip) for two entrees.

ugoWNWJbcvKThg6yssmUQQ.text: Loved the atmosphere, the vibe, and the night we had here! We are vegetarian and went on Valentine's day, putting in our order right after the last portabello melt was sold. I was delighted because they still had plenty of small plate options that were awesome! We had the roasted garlic ($6) which is a whole head of garlic and some grilled bread-- amazing! We also had a potato gnocchi that was fried with some sort of cream sauce on top. They were like little tater tots from heaven. Finally, we had the beet crudo ravioli, which admittedly we didn't understand even after our server explained it to us - but it was a creative, delicious dish.  Some of the less than stellar reviews made me nervous to try this restaurant on date night, but I'm so glad we did. It was a unique Phoenix experience, and I look forward to going back again!

ElJClKQZWjefkOSdse5XJw.text: came here because it was the closest restaurant to us (good 5miles away) that had a reservation open on yelp. The food didn't disappoint and service was great also but they charged a default 20% tip ??? WTF not sure why they did this or if it said it stated on menu but no one in our party was happy about it afterwards.  I ordered the chicken and waffles. the chicken was crazy crispy and the meat was juicy like no other and the waffle was pretty good too. as good as the food was not sure if we want to comeback if they are going to put 20% tip on the bill

Jk45MvYgSY-tbeO6AiBRPQ.text: Hubby and I had dinner at the Tuck Shop Friday night at around 9p. When we walked in, there were still many customers dining and the atmosphere seemed relaxed and calm. We were seated promptly and our waitress was friendly and attentive.   We ordered the chorizo stuffed dates, Mac and cheese, taco salad, and cheese curds. The cheese curds was my favorite! The Mac and Cheese and taco salad weren't bad at all, but I was not a fan of the chorizo stuffed dates. I took one bite and couldn't finish the date. In my opinion, the spicy chorizo and the sweetness of the dates was not a great combination. Hubby also ordered a beer. Total of bill: around $46 plus tip.   Overall, we enjoyed our dinner and the service was fantastic!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Top left: cheese curds; top right: chorizo dates; bottom: Mac and Cheese with bacon

nKf8D5vbghW-ScKKTyIpeg.text: I lived in the Coronado neighborhood for years, and I'm ashamed to say I never visited Tuck Shop. I read that they had recently started opening for brunch on weekends and I finally made a visit.   We were quickly greeted and we requested to sit at the bar. Their drink menu (at least during brunch) is limited. Wine, beer, a $9 mimosa or a $10 Bloody Mary were the only options. This is where it lost a star for me. A little more variety would have been nice. I went with the Bloody Mary which was pretty good.   As for the food, this is why I will come back again and again. My boyfriend had the salmon and eggs and just, wow. The smoked salmon melts in your mouth and is so flavorful! It was amazing. I had the pork belly benedict and it was perfect. The pork belly again just melts in your mouth, the hollandaise was probably the best I've ever tasted. The chef clearly takes pride in his craft and made a point to check in with us to see how we liked it.   The customer service was also top notch. This was our first time there, yet all the staff talked with us like we were regulars which made us feel right at home. The ambiance is nice too, with a little reading nook and couches, as well as tables. It had an upscale feel, yet casual enough that it didn't seem stuffy.   I don't remember our total bill, but I do remember feeling that the price was very reasonable for the quality of food and service. I really hope I'll get a chance to return in the evening when hopefully their craft cocktail menu is available.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly eggs benedict
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. They also offer coffee during brunch
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bloody mary- hope you like horseradish because it has a kick! :)

fSeIGYyJEFtWnJyUlioEFA.text: Great wine selection. Cool out of the way place. Outstanding bread pudding with a whiskey sauce!!

K2NLZKLoJ80S1weuHkTCjg.text: Delightful venue in the Coronado Historic District! Kudos to other Yelp reviewers for leading me here! This mid century modern building is perfect for this eclectic dining experience! Nice selection of wine and cocktails! Appreciated the option of small plates along with full entrees. After selecting our wine, we decided to share the garlic baguette... Excellent choice with so much flavor!  Our salads were fresh and so tasty with apples, walnuts and poppyseed vinegrette! Linda was a very attentive member of the wait staff - attentive and friendly without being obtrusive! Added bonus was meeting owner Grace, such a charmer! We will definitely return to sample other taste treats on the menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Perfect dinner this evening at this eclectic venue! We will definitely return SOON! Roasted garlic was exceptional!

5NEb4Zbg9yT6VIYkE3o-7Q.text: Great food and service every time we go. One thing that stands out is the excellent bartending. These ladies know their stuff and you don't need to explain a classic drink. They have been able to maintain their high standards for quality too.

DV3AoHACTDC9A0rEBl3wpw.text: The People there are gracious and kind! They were so flexible and accommodating of our celebration and requests. It was as if they were a part of our family and the celebration was their own. Wow! I had a reservation for tea for 5 people on a Saturday. When we called earlier in the week to asked about bringing decorations to surprise my sister for her birthday we somehow confused the person we spoke to and the reservation got changed to a brunch instead.  When we showed up, they weren't prepared to present "tea" as they normally do. Within minutes, they bent over backwards to have a beautiful table set up for my sister and plenty of options to make her birthday memorable and keep our surprise party special and fun! Afterwards, they offered to hand wrap our taper candles that we brought in butcher paper so we could reuse them at home. Then, they presented my sister with a lovely teacup and saucer that they had gift wrapped for her. They helped carry our decorations to and from the car and were incredibly kind and welcoming of us into this beautiful space. The food was really delightful and the presentation was magical. We had such a fantastic time!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CrwNZbg-dSbWg_hokSjetQ.text: We stumbled on Tuck by accident and were very pleasantly surprised. We enjoyed breakfast foods for brunch with unique twists and sausages personally made by the owner. At least I think he was the owner. Very personable staff. Highly recommended.

3l6TVsxEy8wrD7yP6fuQGA.text: Daaaaaamn, this place is good.  First off, get the jalapeno cheese curds.  Second off, get the mezcal cocktails.  Or if you're ridiculously hungry, the chicken and waffles.  Good people, great food, and an intimate neighborhood atmosphere.

vERxMmO35Eg_c5oE7bfkpA.text: One of our favorite restaurants in Phoenix. We love the fact that it's hidden in the neighborhood and you'd know about it without Yelp or word of mouth.   Our most recent visit was to celebrate my brother's birthday. We easily booked a reservation for 6 through Yelp and arrived with no issues.  For appetizers we ordered the Mac n cheese, the garlic toast, and tuna tare tare - all of which were very good.  As entree our table consisted of the ribs, the chicken and waffles, the shop salad, the pine steak, and the portobello mushroom.  You can't get much better than any of the items we ordered. The only item that wasn't a hit was the portobello, but that was my mom's, and she doesn't seem to ever love anything. I'll chalk that one up as her being picky.  Also cool, I ordered the chicken and waffles and since we were friendly (I assume) or since we were spending a good amount of money, they gave me a special limited addition Whistle Pig syrup and that Whistle Pig only sends to select bars who use a lot of their whiskey. The syrup was fantastic and the gesture of offering it was even cooler. Whistlepig happens to be one of the my favorites.  Service was outstanding as usual.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Seasonal Shop Salad
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. St. Louis ribs!
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and Waffles. Word.

wTVI0M4Q0Bv88L9d8oDUig.text: Wow, simply amazing food.  Seevice was excellent but a little busy for out server.  First appetizers were pan fried gnocchi in some cheese gravy was decadent and excellent.  The charcuterie board was excellent.  The wine selection was very good with some suggestions.  Main course was very Rich, prepared excellent, Chilean sea bass, short rib was excellent.  Desserts were great as well.  I would give this experience 5 stars.  Just make sure you make reservations ahead of time because Limited seating and the word is out on the quality!!! Go on your next test me out and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

TEBOJH9ofrTZYe33GegD6g.text: An absolute wonderful dining experience. The food, ambiance and service was delightful. The cocktails are creative and full of flavor. We ordered the charcuterie board, lobster mac and cheese, steak and frites and the ribs entree. We over indulged and it was worth every bite. I will definitely be returning and have already started recommending to friends.

W6DWzEsi4mLh4SPeCUuqdQ.text: Don't  miss the Cumberland sausages.  They are one of the chefs,lee,pride and joys.  Made totally from scratch

z42wbwWQqp1aEX8Om8zA1Q.text: The Tuck Shop more like that Luck Shop! As in lucky to have found this gem. The food was amazing, the atmosphere matched. I had several servers just stop by to chat and see how the food was the staff was so endearing and each had a story to tell about something we were eating. Loved the excitement and joy the servers had which is rare especially during the holiday season. We had the chicken and waffles and the steak and sweet potato fritters. Talk about decadent!! Will be back for more...great date spot or just a night of great food and booze.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

XO93j6rYzB_1VhSrkjv5UA.text: Came here for the first time last night and had an amazing experience!  I don't know the area at all, so I got a little lost trying to find it.  The bartender answered the phone when I called and was very friendly and helpful in giving directions.  She was also the first to welcome me as I walked in the door.    I sat at the bar while I waited for my date to arrive.  She recommended at great beer from San Diego - maybe one of the best beers I've had in a long time!  My date arrived and we were seated immediately.  We ordered vodka martinis and the brussels sprout app right away.  We later tried three of the small plates - gnocchi, tacos, and chorizo dates along with some wine.  Everything was amazing and the service was fast and very friendly.  The food here is incredible!  I can't wait for my next visit.    Verdict:  HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

TtjSdPtUV5LM5kVJ6nV10w.text: I really cant believe that I am only finding out about this amazing restaurant right now.  I think to myself about how many delicious meals I could have had here, while instead eating elsewhere.  I went to this restaurant on Saturday night, and was seated almost instantly.  It was a full restaurant and the ambiance was incredible.  The staff was extremely friendly and more importantly very knowledgeable.  For the first time in a very long while I met someone, Grace, who happened to know as much about Bourbon, Scotch, and Whiskey as I do.  She was great to talk to and learn about their liquors and why they have specific ones.  The food portion or our experience was even better than the Whiskey, which I don't say much.  I had the Pork Loin with some onion rings on the side, and the table also had the Pine Steak.  Both meals were exceptional and I would recommend either one as a main course.  We also ordered Beet Ravioli, Cheese Curds, and Zucchini Planks, all of which were perfectly done.  This is a must try, and I promise you will be back again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. An amazing menu at an amazing restaurant.

d2EoW-a2hpWFKaSEp7QZng.text: Every single time we visit we're always immediately finding ways to return. Food, service, and experience... top notch!

gNuNbzummYqZq4106qa--w.text: I love this place, great service and food. The service is excellent from the moment you enter the restaurant. This is hands down, one of the best fine dining experience I have had in a while. I can't wait to go back and enjoy the menu.

UH4kvP1FMBw5rBGfDjLYGA.text: This great - if you like comfort food, this is the spot for you. It's fancy, plus comfort, and they do it well. I'm not a comfort food fan, so it's not for me, but other than that, it's a great restaurant.

1jLK53w-03fRqF7wJ-WplQ.text: Went here Friday night. They have an interesting way of taking reservations.   It's $20 a head and they pre-charge your card no refunds. Then that is credited to your meal. An interesting way of doing things.  Our meal was average to good. We got a pulled pork slider, lasagna nachos or something along those lines, mac and cheese. Nothing was AMAZING, but the lasagna nachos were really good. They also gave us an amazing dessert on the house, it was like a cheesecake brownie and my girlfriend and I didn't make it to the car without splitting half of it. The location kind of sneaks up on you because it's in a quiet neighborhood. The service was great.

ciK-HX6N8gg_eXT0qv--BQ.text: Lobster mac and cheese ($12/13?) - rich in lobster flavor. They do not skimp out on the lobster meat here. I'm usually not a fan of mac and cheese but being a lobster junkie this was very satisfying.  Stuffed Mejool Dates ($11) - The dates are overwhelmingly sweet and did somehow compliment the savory flavors of the gruyere cheese and chorizo. This dish was very overpowering in taste and while it was an interesting combination, I'm not sure if I would order it again.   Pine AZ Spiced Steak ($23) - Nothing special, just a steak with a few slices of sauteed mushroom.  We had our meal to go and not sure if take out orders are smaller but the lobster mac and cheese came in a small cardboard box, there were only 4 stuffed mejool dates and a tiny portion of the steak with a meager amount of sauteed mushrooms.   Good meal but a ripoff, I didn't feel like the meal was worth ~50 dollars.

CCy0E6j0pz7j0qhSUwpecg.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Phoenix. Much more character and charm than most places in Phoenix. The food and service are fantastic! The bartender is great too. The ambiance is relaxed yet sophisticated. Great place for visiting with friends and they will let you take as long as you like for dinner.

zJeiH106kZZ08FwkIJKmzw.text: We had so much fun here for dinner. The four of us shared seven plates. The cheese curds, scallop Caprese, duck, lamb, lobster mac and cheese, and the beet ravioli. That beet ravioli will stay with me as a True craving. So delicious and innovative and fresh. The service was really friendly and we like the atmosphere too. We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobster Mac and cheese
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb meatballs
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Beet ravioli

A0quVpsmjxwb5nC7hMY22w.text: My wifey and I came here last night.   I had seen this while browsing through for some place good to eat since I didn't want to go to Macaroni Grill or Outback.   Parking was lacking but I guess it's fitting for a place that can probably fit like only two dozen people. There's additional parking across the street like a stone's throw away and I guess you could always try parking along the street.  We came in and the first thing I saw...young female hipsters, ha. Turned my head and saw a Ipad laying there and was like, "I knew it!" Nonetheless, I figured, this place will be interesting.   The interior was actually pretty nice. Small, maybe like two dozen people could be in here but it was nice. There was wood paneling. The lights were dimmed to set a cozy, intimate environment with some light music playing the background.   We were seated fast and got glasses of water and a menu fast. We looked at the menu. Their beverage menu is alright, befitting a cozy hole in the wall with some choice drafts and some decent wine. She had moscato. I didn't feel like drinking soda or alcohol so I kept my water.   The prices were alright. Decent on the entrees but a little more than expected on the appetizers.   We had got the cheese curds which were good (They're not Wisconsin good but still pretty decent) and garlic baguettes served with a herb roasted garlic clove and olive oil for spread which, was delicious. Here's where you can definitely tell this place is very good for dates...the Entrees portion was called "For Sharing...". They give you decent enough portions to share amongst two people. Very nice. We picked out the rib eye since my lady was craving red meat (lol, no pun). I got a small brisket taco on the side which came with a guacamole with a slight kick to it. It's no Thai hot but had a decent kick to it.  The taco was actually stacked pretty high with brisket meat and some minced vegetables. It was VERY good. The rib eye came with a side of grilled carrot brochettes and baby potatoes. She really liked the carrots. Dessert was two FREE cookie dough balls with chocolate drizzle.  Frankly, I thought everything was good. The only reason why I gave four stars instead of five was because my lady disliked our server's speed in service. My lady had remarked that there wasn't many people here and we still had to wait a more than reasonable amount of time and our server was just chatting. I saw but thought nothing of it but the woman is always right...never argue, ever. It's too cold to sleep on the couch these nights. Other than that, I figured this place is worth a visit and I wouldn't mind coming back again.

QSlEbufkdBezvVb0hoBFPQ.text: Where to start... How about the fact that they make their own mixers! Tonic water, ginger ale, sour mix, lemonade. Literally all made from scratch. And if that doesn't sell you, this will:  My man and I started with the cheese curds and baguette for apps. If you love cheese as much and my boyfriend and I do, then the curds are a do-not-miss. But the baguette? Oh man, it was insane. It came with a whole roasted garlic that had been stuffed with herbs and spices, and the roasting made the garlic spreadable almost like a butter. It was literally drool-worthy.   Next, he got the steak and I got the pork tenderloin and we both split the Mac & cheese. The seasoning on the steak was perfection, and the garlic mashed potatoes it came with were a perfect pairing. The Mac and cheese was pretty good. I'm a sucker for anything that includes prosciutto, but I'll admit they were a bit too runny for my taste. But the pork! Let me tell you about this pork! You could cut the thing with a butter knife. I know. I tried. It was the most unbelievably tender tenderloin I think I've ever had.   They ended the meal on a very high note... Instead of giving you boring, run-of-the-mill dinner mints, they excite your sweet tooth with a ball of cookie dough drizzled in chocolate. When I was looking through the pics on Yelp I thought this was a dessert option on the menu. Imagine my delight when these little balls of sugary heaven showed up on my plate FO' FREE!  I loved this place. The food, the atmosphere, the fact that it's in a house that was re-structured just for the restaurant. Everything about it I loved. Definitely a must-go if you're in the Phoenix area.

3KSgDZ8TBy3ENKlb9q1-kg.text: This is a really delightful restaurant.  It's cozy, warm and inviting.  Reminds you of someone's private home. We sat at the bar, and were really overwhelmed - immediately- and the warmth of the folks who work there and all the attention we received.  Had we chosen a table, I am not sure what it would have been like, but I could hear the servers talking to the tables behind us about their food options, the recommendations (based always on input from the customer) and the lovely specials.  Ohh the food!  It was unique, very tasty and fun! I loved the brussel sprouts, alway a favorite, and the fried chicken was the best EVER!  I don't order fried chicke, but it was tender, lightly breaded and succulunt beyond my imagination.  The best thing was that the wine and beer were on special so that we could enjoy a reasonably price night out, without breaking the bank or getting frustrated over feeling like we didn't get the value for the price.  It was ON the mark!!  We will be back...

v_VKHP_zBVch9TZDDWsFOw.text: Found this little gem for a date night, with some friends of ours.  We arrived about 6pm and were greeted  and seated promptly.  There was a large party reserved and what we thought was going to be a problem was not at all.  Our server was great and very knew the menu well.  He mentioned that the menu was changing soon, and we will definitely be back to try the new menu.  Love this place and will definitely be back!

WbR70BkmoiKM5_3kFHnSvg.text: I enjoyed a delicious birthday dinner at the Tuck Shop last night. The place is tucked back (sorry about the pun) in a quiet, older neighborhood in Phoenix. It was like showing up to Mom's house for dinner. So comfortable and cozy inside. Loved EVERYTHING about the ambiance! We ordered about four of the six starters...Duck Tostada, Cheese Curds, Fontina Sticks, and the Parsnip & Potato Poutine. All the starters, except the duck tostada, revolved around cheese  which was a little rich. Still yummy, but quite rich. I ordered the Salmon which was cooked perfectly and the risotto was great! The others in our party enjoyed their meals as well....they ordered the Pine AZ Spiced Steak (which looked SOOO good medium-rare), the Lobstah Mac n Cheese, and the Meat and Three which I think was a BBQ Pork Shoulder with jalapeno corn bread, collard greens, and some sort of chicken soup. Not a single one of us was disappointed with our meals. I'm so glad I finally ventured over to try this spot! Would love to come back once I'm eating meat again (trying Pescetarianism for a year) and try more of the menu. Also, big shout out to David! He was our server and did a fabulous job with us. He was knowledgeable, attentive, and had an adorable personality. Thanks David at Tuck Shop! :)  -I'm a little bummed that I wasn't given a cocktail menu. After reading other reviews, the signature cocktails sound amazing! =-( Next time I guess.

cMxvQnFRKNvze9Hk_pWBtg.text: An Exceptional Experience.  Service: Excellent You are welcomed by a non pretentious friendly staff who will seat you promptly if you have a booking, otherwise you have the option to be seated at the bar or take drinks in the adjoining Mid Century Modern Lounge where drinks are served. The knowledgable servers have great drink recommendations and pairings with food.  Atmosphere: Vibrant The Tuck Shop has a warm cosy unassuming relaxed feel. The lounge is a well thought out space with ample seating to enjoy drinks while waiting to be seated.  Drinks: Great Selection When seated at our table we were presented with an impressive drinks menu which included an assortment of cocktail's, a nice selection of wines and finally for the beer drinkers a selection of Larger's, Ales, IPA's and Porter. I was impressed with the IPA on tap which had the hoppy flavor without the bitter after taste.   Food: Excellent. Having been there three times in the last month I am slowly making my way through tasting everything on the menu.  Starters, so far I have tried the following: Cheese Curds, Grilled Baguette, Savory Pancake, Zucchini Planks and Sonoran Pigs in a Blanket. The flavor and texture of the starters was excellent but my favorite was the Pigs in a Blanket closely followed by the Grilled Baguette. The Pigs in a Blanket contained a local favorite Schreiners sausage wrapped in flaky crisp pastry with bacon, pinto beans and pico, the flavor was exceptional.  Smaller Plates, I had the "Lobstah Mac and Cheese", I have never been impressed with a Mac and Cheese dish until now. The "Lobstah Mac and Cheese" dish was exceptional. The cheese which had the flavor of a Dublin cheddar was complimented by the infused herbs and crowned with a piece of Lobster cooked to perfection. This combination produced a sophisticated flavor with a variety of textures which delighted the palette with every bite.  Main Dish, I have tried the Chicken and Waffles and Steak & Frites. The Chicken and Waffles was great but the Steak & Frites were exceptional. I had the Filet Mignon cooked Medium-Rare and it did not disappoint. The flavor of the steak combined with the red wine sauce and texture of the meat was mouthwatering, needless to say all the steak was cleared. The frites were crisp as expected and complimented the juices of the steak and wine sauce.  Finally I had a Cappuccino or two which were great.   This restaurant sets a new standard in service, ambience, selection of drinks, exceptional food and value for money.  Will be back soon.

rwuq2WctQBC-uFgsIYeU7Q.text: Tuck Shop is my favorite! Really relaxing. Great service. And the chicken and waffles are awesome. We have had many meals there -- they never miss!

W_fkzDcX4TFqGuwIprjWOQ.text: Get out of the 'burbs, people - downtown Phoenix is where it's at!   I've visited the Phoenix area four times in the past year, and on every trip, I ask somebody to take me downtown. The usual responses are: "Um, I've never been there," "Why?" "Nobody goes there," "There's nothing downtown."  On all my previous trips, I begrudgingly listened to them and kept eating at the plethora of urban Italian wine bar places that seem to run rampant in this area. You know what I'm talking about - dark, "trendy," lots of bruschetta, pizzas, and wine.   Well, on this trip, I decided to take the reigns and just go downtown. I grabbed some colleagues and just drove into the center of downtown Phoenix. I pulled over at a gas station and whipped out my iPhone to use my beloved Yelp app to find a dinner spot. And that's when I was pointed to Tuck Shop.  As I drove down the dark, residential street, my navigation system led me to what looked like somebody's house. After nervously parking (Is this really it?!), my friends and I walked inside to one of the most pleasant surprises! The inside of Tuck Shop is beautiful, homey, and very mid-century modern.  We were warmly greeted by the staff and sat in their comfortable waiting space and had classic cocktails. Do yourself a favor and get the house-made ginger ale and whiskey. Yum!  For dinner, here's what we had: * cheese curds - delicious little fried bites of heaven * chorizo-stuff dates - sweet and spicy * mac and cheese with "lobstah" - two of my friends got this and raved over it * beet cannelloni - earthy and delicious * chicken and waffles - perfectly cooked chicken with light and crispy waffles  We all left that night extremely happy that we ventured downtown and discovered such a fantastic place!

uKAlm3a6WsXfkMv2hynDvQ.text: Seriously?  Oh my gosh. I can't even. Comfort Food.   It's so good. Okay. So my first time ever going to Tuck Shop, I was like.. I don't know about this random little restaurant that literally is tucked away...But then I tasted the first bite of the appetizer and immediately realized the mistake I had made by pre-judging this adorable little restaurant.   Like I said... little. It's pretty small inside, but ALWAYS busy. How can it not be busy with food that tastes so great and amazing wine specials to match. It's like Tuck Shop was invented for the sole purpose of making your mouth happy.   I need to stop. I'm getting hungry thinking about it. The stuffed dates are perfect. If you decide to try Tuck Shop, do yourself a favor and try them. The Beef Cannelloni is fabulous as well. Mac and Cheese. OMG.   And, although I am NOT a chicken and waffle kind of gal, it is so good here. I couldn't help but want to order it again.   Needless to say, Tuck Shop is easily a favorite and one that I will be returning to in the near future.

2HrLVZ2HmhfjggCIuAXX7Q.text: Relaxed atmosphere with delicious food and great staff. Accidentally found it when looking for somewhere to go before a theater show.

NWfvWkMupJMyI6hnT7aWCQ.text: I was invited to High Tea at The Tuck Shop a few weeks ago. I was so impressed I wish I would have taken a picture or two because everything was so detailed and beautiful. I was so engaged by everything going on that I didn't even think about my phone. If you are looking for somewhere fun and elegant you must try high tea at the tuck shop. It was a perfect girls day event!

mEYAo8zj7FQDqcHm4l9nUw.text: The thing I love about this restaurant is the laid back yet sophisticated atmosphere in which you eat 5 star food without all the fuss. The food is amazing. We had the bread and roasted garlic, the goat cheese salad, and the vegetable ravioli. All of it was spot on. I couldn't have asked for a better meal, I would eat there every night if I could afford it. Their food is worth every penny.

oWUw2ev1eOr1HHZu0Efvgw.text: portions may be on the small side here, but the flavors are on-point and the prices are very reasonable.  -good-to-great food w/ creative daily specials and a seasonal menu -easy parking across the street with TWO overflow lots -friendly and efficient servers...didn't see a lot of too-young people (e.g. Fox Restaurants); moreso, restaurant pros who've been at it for a minute (did not have to ask for refills on drinks and stopped by to check on quality of meal)  really quaint neighborhood joint that would be a GREAT date spot. only critique is that at dinner the house lights are probably a little too low. more light would allow the excellent food to be even more appreciated.  solid.

duv-tITHywPw6gEWeh0UnQ.text: Awesome food and service. Starting with the drink a martini to appetizers pigs in a blanket and vegetable cievicheyummmmmmm.  We went well and couple and it's a great place to share!   Pork tenderloin was juicy, chicken and waffles was delish.  I could go on you will not be disappointed.   Be patient on a Friday night it gets busy and place is small!  They end 5he meal with cookie dough.....

_1HsgasNfCuCGaIo0nZGbg.text: Looking for a True neighborhood spot where food and atmosphere are top notch? Then the Tuck Shop should be your first spot.  This place is inviting, comfortable, done well and the food and staff are amazing too! Lobster Mac & Cheese - I am mean how could you go wrong?  This it is delish.  Chicken and waffles - this ain't Lolo's (Thankfully!) great!

oGxJzlMPfTLV_mgTL34VlQ.text: The Tuck Shop hates your baby.   This past weekend my husband, 2 other couples, myself and our 1 year old attempted to eat at the Tuck Shop. We had told them all how amazing this place was and were jazzed to eat there as it had been a couple years since we had been in.  We got there right at 5 when they opened, as we were around the corner at the PHX Art Museum. We walked in and were promptly greeted. We asked for 6 adults plus a high chair...when we got a dead pan "we don't have high chairs" response.   Tuck Shop you are sending a very loud and clear message that you do not care to serve families. (insert slow clap here)

ei4u7vtcFY4cTJZE6GBBCA.text: i took my mom and sister here over Memorial Day weekend! They loved it just as much as I did!

29tvH3-BEOQPMvcrlNjDGw.text: Very cozy atmosphere with an eclectic menu.  Portion sizes on large plates are generous and many tables were sharing plates to have a variety.  The wine list has great selections, and Grace knows her inventory and is superb at assisting with pairing.

SiTmKGfHYXzyuNVdNPuKpA.text: Tucked in the wrong place?  My first thought driving through the residential area was there's something wrong with the directions to this place.  However, to my surprise, it was indeed a "tucked away" restaurant.  My first impression of this place was it was a cute little home with a family room as a waiting room, which I thought was pretty cool. Not a lot of sitting space so I hope you come on a slow day.  We ordered 3 items, the Brussels Sprouts, Date salad, and the Lamb Meatballs.  The Brussels Sprouts was crispy and tasted of charred vegetables.  Guess it was supposed to be that way but wasn't right for my palate.  The dates salad was definitely my favorite!  It had a hint of sourness from the dressing and sweetness from the dates -- nice and light.  The lamb meatballs were good I thought, but nothing to rave about.  Wasn't gaming like most lambs, but I thought the marinara sauce over powered everything.    Service was good nothing to say here.  The host was kind and attentive. - Enjoy!

z7uf22r7mpckKz3m56nhig.text: I've only been to Tuck Shop once, after having dreamed of how amazing it would be and never finding myself in the area, which I think is the only real drawback. It's never in my line of sight, so to speak, and I occasionally only remember it when it's not convenient to go. That is also part of the charm though.  So anyway, there I was making a daring move to go to a place I'd never been for my birthday (daring to my friends anyway), and it was one of the best experiences I've ever had. We sat at half of the community table, and even the pickiest of eaters found items they enjoyed on the menu. As for me, my eyes saw nothing but the home-brewed ginger ale (I make my own ginger simple syrup) and the chicken and waffles. The food was so amazing, no one spoke during most of it. And while they didn't have dessert really for the birthday girl, they brought me out a scoop of cookie dough, in a cute glass dish, with a candle on it. It was awesome they cared enough to make the best of the dessert menu they had.  The vibe is very relaxing, even on a Saturday evening. The service was just the right speed and not at all too pushy and no one minded our birthday gifts and small chatter. To this day, friends are asking when we are going to go back. My answer is always, "Maybe my next birthday." This truly may become birthday ritual.

mv0MN2SF1U_w6VEbqoaaHA.text: Trying out a new restaurant on Valentine's Day is not something I would normally recommend...especially in the neighborhood of 12th st between Thomas and McDowell (at night).  However, we had a GREAT experience!    The restaurant was an old home with a lot of modern flair.  The tables were spaced out well (so you weren't packed in like sardines in a can).  With reservations, they pull out the scrabble tiles and spell out your name (what a neat touch)!  Everything from the food, to the service, to the bartender (who can actually mix drinks), and even to the manager who was very nice and helpful.  Highly recommend the Cheese Curds, Poutine, and the Red Beans and Rice!  I am fairly certain that we will be going back again...and soon!

dkwSRoSrfztpUSbWI4h9dg.text: I have to say my ladyfriend and I were both a bit disappointed with the tuckshop....perhaps because we had both read so many wonderful reviews from Yelptard nation.  I was especially excited to try the fried cheese curds and the Mac n cheese....tbc soon.....,

DSeyhCcBG9xNMgy7c80Xew.text: I was really disappointed in their waffles and macaroni-n-cheese. The waffles came with no syrup, and two small teaspoon size sweet butter. The waffles melted in your mouth, but tasted like potatoes.   Avoid their homemade lemonade, it tasted like tea. When I asked if they mistakenly gave us tea, the waitress had an apologetic face suggesting we were not the first to question it.  The macaroni n cheese was okay, but for $13 it was a small plate and on the dry side. The $6 add on for lobster was NOT a generous amount and disappointing.   The chicken and green beans that came with the waffles were superb.   I would of been okay with the $50 bill for two had the food tasted better.  Restaurant is in a quite looking neighborhood, good ambience inside and friendly staff.

IF3pE-Bc3477-yDfrWSfPw.text: Shared a pre concert dinner here with friends and family and came away very impressed!   The ambiance and service were great...low key, understated and genuine approach to service  The chorizo stuffed dates were off the hook! The chicken and waffles were very tasty and not too heavy with the green beans included with them stealing the spotlight!  I can't wait to get back and enjoy this little gem hidden in historic Coronado district in downtown Phoenix!

in_29RNNbHmrQraOzHYHxA.text: This is the best date spot in Phoenix. Super cozy, great wine list, and service is excellent! The manager brought us a complimentary sample of Riesling which I usually don't go for but it complimented the salmon dish so well! Thanks for being a great addition to Phoenix!

eZKbAMN4UNULXOEZxjCFYw.text: The ambience is cozy and modern. The service is second to none. The food is local, fresh, and cooked used classic cooking techniques. The cheese curds are a perfectly salted deep fried cheese ball. The Mac N Cheese was the perfect balance of cheese and bacon. The pork loin and onions rings were tender and crisp. The lamb special was cooked to a perfect medium rare and the prices are very reasonable. The place is small so they do require a deposit for the reservation but it's worth it!
