habgWPbI8H44utEH8dLdpA.text: One of Phoenix's best kept secrets. I love everything about this place! The food is always great, as is the service. It's the kind of place that is easy to stay at for hours! I'm sorry to the staff for the times I've done it. I think the good drinks and the good environment just make it easy for the night to fly by. This restaurant is my personal go-to for a birthday celebration, or just a nice dinner.  The food is amazing. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. I haven't ordered everything but the roasted garlic, the gnocchi, Brussels sprouts, the dates, the pork belly, chicken and waffles.. are just some of my favorites.

E4KzI9lBVmONOPwqRK9DhA.text: David and I love this place, the food is great! It's such a warm and inviting place, We drive from Tucson a couple times a month to Enjoy the great food the wonderful staff ,It's a really great find. I would recommend the Tuck Spot to everyone!  If you get a chance, order the bread pudding! It's nothing like you've ever had before! They also provide a fully stocked bar. It's very reasonably priced and I cannot wait to go back!

Xic_1FGGgoyrjeJ-rCpHLA.text: An absolute must. Staff and ambience are impeccable. Food is out of this world. After having the chicken and waffles you will re-rank your best chicken meals ever because a new number 1 is in town.  Warm, friendly, and perfect for a relaxing evening or impress your girl on date night. Cant wait to come back!

LKHsjXlcLJ1Gp0eBGYWxhg.text: Me and my husband found this place by accident trying to find a quick bite to eat one morning on our anniversary. It turned out to be one of the best places we've ever ate at. There was a bit of a mix up with our order but our waiter was super nice about it and brought us the raspberry croissant (free of charge) to make up for it and we definitely weren't disappointed. It's the best thing I've ever tasted and my favorite desert. We now come here every year on our anniversary

ywNs6fHMPaigfy7fNVTKtQ.text: How have I not dined here this whole time? Tuck Shop has everything I love in a restaurant. The atmosphere is beautiful. It is intimate and classy without the pretentiousness. The staff make you feel right at home. Everything I ordered was delectable.   We started out with the cheese curds. They were deliciously fried goodness. The batter reminds me of the batter they use for calamari. My boyfriend thought they were too greasy and salty but I honestly enjoyed them. My sister ordered the shop salad which we enjoyed. The dressing was so good and the steak that accompanied it was cooked perfectly. We also ordered the pan fried gnocchi and this was one of my favorite dishes of the night. I never thought I would enjoy fried gnocchi but I did. It tasted perfect with the parmesan cheese sauce (it might have been polenta?). For my main dish, I had one of their specials, crab cakes with frittes. The crab cakes came with delicious aioli and the frittes were crispy and paired well with the cakes. My friends ordered the chicken and waffles and they didn't think the chicken in particular was anything special. My friend said she didn't like the way it was seasoned but the green beans were perfect. They also enjoyed the mac and cheese. This restaurant is a little pricey, too pricey for downtown Phoenix in my opinion ($39 for crab cakes) but over all, I believe it was well worth it.   At the end of our meal, our wonderful server Dustin gave us all tequila shots on the house. I loved this restaurant from the moment we stepped in and I can't wait to be back.

roP1fNHiY1yYVmGKoG9fBA.text: Amazing. Comfort food in a hip cozy atmosphere. I will be coming back . Food wise I recommend the ribs.

ajnG4ERCYwkp2WhZ0Scleg.text: HOLY foodie heaven. This place made for the most perfect date night! The ambiance, flavors, cocktails, service...everything. It. Was. Perfect. We will absolutely be back again soon!  We ordered delicious fresh cocktails to start! For small plates, we split the roasted garlic + grilled bread, the simple salad (sounds boring but their green goddess dressing is AMAZING!) and the beet crudo ravioli stuffed with herbed goat cheese and topped with a cold tomato sauce. I am STILL dreaming about this dish, and it was gorgeous too.   For the entree, we split the pork with a bacon & bourbon jam glaze, onion rings, and charred radicchio. THE FLAVORS OF THIS DISH WERE OUT OF THIS WORLD. Every single bite made my tastebuds dance!  We didn't save room for dessert but they served our check with cookie dough balls! Uhhh, twist my arm. Can't wait to come back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted garlic to spread on top of grilled bread... Twist my arm!
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yummy gin cocktail
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Delicious salad with green goddess dressing!

t6gut513RbK-SbIdKnz_5Q.text: Tuck Shop is one of the best places to have dinner in Phoenix. The food is always on point, the wine and cocktails are absolutley amazing and the atmosphere just feels like home. Another great aspect to Tuck Shop and what truly creates the "feels like home" vibe are the people that Owner Grace  U. has brought together behind the bar, in the kitchen, and on the floor. Grace goes above and beyond to take care of her people and her customers. My husband and I, an interracial couple has always felt at home at Tuck Shop.   Tuck Shop is a great place to get dinner and find new friends for all people. Any claim that there is discrimination at the Tuck Shop is completely False. I being a black man fully approve of Tuck Shop and its crew.   I will also say that Grace is someone who wants to know of any concern in her place so that it can be corrected immediately.   Thank you Tuck Shop! We will be back in soon.  Kelvin

VvzyRf5GsSrHTifO7xXq_w.text: Did you know Tuck Shop serves brunch?! A lot of different varieties of food. I had the pork belly Benedict which was savory yet sweet. Hubby had the steak and eggs which was very well seasoned and cooked. This particular day was their kickoff for brunch and they offered free drinks with brunch which took forever to serve. Still the food was amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fresh mint gin &amp; juice
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime rib dip
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie benedict

NdMB0AzS8YgPbqd7ZyuCQw.text: O. My. God!! This place just blows me away every time we come here! There is not one thing on the menu that is bad or even marginal and I know because I've had everything. However I do have my favorites.  tonight we had the Shop salad it's a good size salad, (we share it) so so so delicious! My husband isn't crazy about salad and he LOVES it!! Next we had the dates, to die for!! Then, Mac and cheese because we always get if it is on the menu. It did not disappoint! Last was the pork belly I can't even describe how delectable it is! It even comes with a salad -apple frisee salad with maple apple dressing heaven!The owner is so kind and engaging. She stopped by outlet table sever times to make sure we were taken care of and also introduced us to a digestif called amora that is out of this world. I had never had one quite this smooth and delicious.  We also had the raspberry bread pudding for desert. It was actually the last thing I would have picked. It the owner said it was her mother's recipe so we decided to try it and boy were we glad! It's made with croissants and has this divine sauce it is sitting in.  I can't say enough good about this place. Make a reservation and git on over!!

UcjjSU4pwFL_ZRRIoUa6cA.text: We had a very good experience dining out at Tuck Shop. We were lucky got seated right the way without making reservation (Hint: Make reservation). Staff was very friendly and attentive, Grace and Monique were very helpful with making selection of wine (Carr - Cab Franc) and some incredible dishes on the menu. Love it even more when the bar sent us three shots of (tasty) Amora (on the house) along with our order or Creme brulee (which itself was delicious). We were super happy...as we were leaving with a nice rain pouring down. Thanks Tuck Shop !

bFu6JE8WSthVlWe-a0YOrA.text: Let's keep things short. Made my favorite restaurant list in the USA. Ranking tie #1 with Big Fish in Key Largo.

ytAH5uR9IbnHn5APARSixQ.text: Omg!! The best place for brunch hands down! I had chicken and waffles at a few places in Phoenix but none as yummy and tasty as Tuck Shop!

EjhZRB1QDbZ9-mZABBtiaQ.text: Love the tuck shop. Every time I go the menu of the season is delicious and creative. Love the curds. The atmosphere is always relaxed and there always seams to be a crowd. Way to go tuck shop.

hB0pZV13DJDd62unKhekrw.text: With all of the good reviews, I expected more. We came for brunch today for the first time. The interior is very cute and the fresh floral arrangement in the front window adds a nice touch. We arrived at 945 (brunch starts at 9) to find ourselves the second couple inside. It stayed that way till past 1030. I ordered the eggs Florentine which was excellent. The Benedict sauce was delicious and the egg cooked just right. The potato hash was so burned and over-oiled it was inedible. The coffee was very watered down and weak. Our service was excellent with all of the staff attentive and very nice. For the positive reviews and reputation this establishment has, we expected more. Unsure if it was an off day. We will probably return and give it another try as the Benedict was excellent.

UK-TqKJegatBoP_3hdG0TQ.text: Love this place!!  Chicken and waffles are always to die for, but the pigs in a blanket were especially scrumptious and the service is impeccable!!  If you have never been I recommend the cheese curds to begin and the Mac and cheese!!!!!

qmRuwkSzuO_Gc0uJPgeYnA.text: I wish I lived in Phoenix, if only I could go to Tuck Shop every week!  The pulled pork sandwich was to-die-for, and the sides that came with it were great!  While you'd usually find such fare at a down-home BBQ joint, this meal was as classy as it gets--I had a glass of wine to go with it.  Very classy place--perfect for a date night or fun girls dinner!

7Ka-DeXELsR2HDXWGPDw-g.text: I really, really wanted to love this place. I was excited about so many things on the menu... The fried cheese curds (I've been craving since I visited Wisconsin), the lobster Mac and cheese, and the chicken and waffles. However, I was let down on all of them. Maybe my expectations were too high.... :/ The cheese curds didn't have as much flavor as I had hoped and were quite greasy. The lobster Mac and cheese wasn't very cheesy at all. And the chicken and waffles had no sweetness to counter the salty. The fried chicken was good and the service was good. But sadly, I was disappointed by the meal.

EeOLm9G9S_dylqMLkKPpWg.text: I checked out the web site - made plans with my wife for a date night - for her birthday.  Show up at tuck shop at 8pm on a Saturday night - and we are greeted with a sign that the place is reserved for the night!  Checked the web site and no message nothing - so off we went to find another place to eat.  Would it kill then to post something on their web site...

pEgvlAgQIyz2HkV064hgEw.text: This place has the MOST comfortable comfort food I have ever tried.... My night ended in a food coma. So there.  We walked in and were seated right away. I love the feel of this place. Warm, welcome, quirky, and just the kind of place I really enjoy. I notice a few large windows near a sofa. Sparce soft lighting. Different wooden tables. A strip of wood panels on the ceiling. Plenty of bar seating.  Art on the walls. What more can a girl like me ask for?  Food, that's what. Oh and a beverage!  David approached our table to tell us about the drink specials and then gave us a few minutes to decide. We decided on a couple dark and stormies.... Best I've ever had. Really.  We placed our order for food and just to have it come out as it was ready.   First came the cheese curds. My favorite bar food. Lightly beer battered, seasoned to perfection and delicious!  Next came the mac and cheese. Saucy, creamy, rich and well seasoned. Covered in proscutto, bread crumbs, and lobstah! I have a weakness for really good mac and cheese. This one is way, way up there. Then our chicken and waffles came out! Three crispy pieces of fried chicken perfectly scortched and well seasoned greenbeans and a huge sweet, flaky waffle smothered in butter. Finally it was desert time. David told us that the deserts change every few weeks and named what was available. We chose the Brazilian banana bread pudding. This desert was perfect.   My friend and I shared these plates. Don't try to conquer all of them on your own. You will really end up in a real food coma. So. Much. Good. Food.   I might still be in said food coma...  Xx, Reesie

knEpoD5HaXb58EO8y-tNMQ.text: FINALLY went for dinner and it didn't disappoint. The food is top notch, and although we sat at the bar we were quite comfortable. We ordered a start, a smaller plate and a sharing plate and split each one. Every bite was a True pleasure. These, along with the INCREDIBLE whiskey sours (all mixers are made in house - huge plus if you like cocktails as we do) left us well satisfied. Will return in a heartbeat.   Atmosphere is a relaxed hip-no pretension here-and while it is a small place it's not overly crowded or noisy. Great energy compliments the food and drink which is top shelf. If you are looking for a local place that you will want to come back to and bring  your family and friends-this is a good spot to check out.   We would have given them 5 stars, but we called from the parking lot to ask if there was a wait for two and were told no wait. When we walked in, the wait was 45+ minutes. We were lucky because we were immediately seated at the bar, but this is a turn-off as far as we were concerned.   End note: The bartender (forgive us - Lori, Laurie, or Lauren) was an excellent bartender, was able to help us decide what to order, and her choices were dead-on!

AMGrz1Syobv0cIhmnH6JUQ.text: I found this place on a mission with Tia- my partner foodie in crime.  What a little piece of joy! Comfort food with soul, its got class, its got style.. its bad-ass!    A new favorite place in town.  I cannot wait to take my baby back!

_aAjRhOrtPYncbbBOrAN5w.text: Great neighborhood place ... Charcuterie was excellent, as was pizza ... Filled up quickly, so reservations are key ... Will definitely be back

y9nD6lAWbnu08yZhgYRLsA.text: Folks, grab a seat here this summer as the tourist masses have left.  I can do a reverse review and indicate what I don't like. Tuck Shop has me addicted to chicken & cheese waffles and their desserts are so good that you will try two. Scallop ceviche was full of flavors, including mango. Service is on par with their excellent food quality; I appreciated the labeling of the leftover containers.

t7fCa_QlQ1nTELhQd2FvGg.text: Probably my new favorite Phoenix restaurant!  We came on a Friday night without reservations and were seated immediately at the community table.  The most outstanding part of our visit was the host and wait staff.  They were professional yet friendly- a perfect balance.  And the food was amazing, but you can read other peoples' reviews for more descriptions of that.  I'm coming back for my birthday.  Thanks, Tuck Shop!

N1KKssh_SfyjSn38C8DjOg.text: Amazing food and a great location "tucked" away like a suburban home. A great dining experience!

jbGTUVCN1HVN-5dfNftlww.text: Attended my first ever High Tea at the Tuck Shop. I wasn't sure what to expect but it was such a fun afternoon. It is a beautiful facility, cozy and fun. The staff just blended in. The perfect way to be served. Our food and tea were refilled effortlessly. The food was phenomenal and the teas delightful. I was surprised how much I enjoyed the experience and would highly recommend anyone wanting a High Tea experience to do so at Tuck Shop. You will not be disappointed. #hightea

wxxvU6O2b8WTlZj9lIex0g.text: i've been meaning to come here for awhile now and glad that I did.  The place feels like someone's home:  warm, inviting, and relaxing.  In fact the waiting area was setup like someone's living area with couches, books, art, etc.  We started off with a few cocktails and they make them good and strong!  The okra and shrimp came with some interesting dipping sauces and had quite a kick.  I am not a big southern comfort food fan but Tuck Shop does bring a nice, light touch their dishes.  The mac n' cheese was good but I expected it to be divine, especially with lobster added to it.  The baby lettuce salad was refreshing on a hot, summer night in the desert.  But the pork t-bone was my favorite of what we tried as it was juicy, well-seasoned and perfectly cooked.  The servers were friendly and courteous and made the dining experience a great one.  Looking forward to going back1

SdJyPMgiJRPFJ4WceHZm8A.text: This place is described as a hidden gem in several Phoenix publications. Couldn't agree more!

joKyu3Ddp-F1YgL9scfcDA.text: Come here many times place is great for large groups or nice date night. Service is amazing, and atmosphere is perfect. Yes cheese curds, yes what ever the special is.

aa-d5pAEhHKSwCV_nCTMDg.text: Love! Love! Love!!!!!! So charming! EVERYTHING was AMAZING!! A group of us tried pretty much everything on the menu and every plate was licked clean.  The fried cheese curds were my fave.  I also found a new favorite local wine! Dos Cabezas red wine : )

BHEJpup2URNMJc25XvGYzw.text: Visited this restaurant last night with a friend. If it was not for my friend, I would have not known about this little gem in Phoenix. I have lived in Phoenix for twenty years and I have never heard of this place. The menu is unique which I love. Our server was knowledgeable and kind. Off of the menu we started with the a light Cheese Curds snack and street taco's. The food came out quickly after ordering it. Then we tried the Mac and Cheese off of the small plate menu. The two of us were beginning to get full so split an entree of meatloaf which was a special this evening. I thought the meatloaf was a little bland but the sauce was great with a kick to it. I probably would not order the meatloaf again if I went back. The white cheddar waffle was okay but somehow too eggy for my tastes. My friend ordered chorizo stuffed dates and he was very happy with his choice. We ordered two desserts that were special and not on the menu. Both were excellent, one chocolate flourless torte and one strawberry. This restaurant is small with only about a dozen tables and we did not have a wait when we arrived at 6:30 pm on a Saturday. If you arrive much later, expect a wait. They have a small bar but that was full by 7 PM. There is an area with a couch to wait comfortably. We were there for two hours, enjoying our food and wine.  This restaurant is located in a house in a residential area which adds to the uniqueness of it.  For you carb lovers like me, they did not serve bread. I can list every restaurant based on good bread so that was my only disappointment here.

sNge-i3yStOUW-p82dWa4g.text: The tea and desserts are amazing! I went with my friends for High Tea and we tried about a dozen pastries and desserts. Amazing creams, crusts and mousses. Raspberry mouse like tart is mouthwatering. I also really liked their sandwiches, cucumber and the egg salad were most memorable! The tea is great, I preferred the English Breakfast but that's my taste, my friend preferred the raspberry! Can't wait to go again!

Sok59nOBfr18Q2YFSEZvyA.text: A hidden gem near downtown Phoenix. It's a small, quaint restaurant in the middle of a residential neighborhood with an elegant, trendy atmosphere.  Certainly a solid choice if you are looking for drinks and tasty food at a place that is not too hectic or loud.  Food is delicious, particularly the small plates, service is friendly and attentive, and the prices are reasonable.  Definitely worth checking out, particularly if you are on a date.

Seg1uM04mOWWqNAtEu0CZQ.text: Tried the lobstah mac n' cheese. It's good but the price is a little high and the portion is about less than average for the cost. Over all nice place and ambience. Staff is very friendly. I love the fact that they offer take out.

vMSNGgiFRS_SkxySl2OgJg.text: Unbelievably good coffee and the eggs Benedict with pork were delicious. Great atmosphere A neighborhood place across the street from the also awesome Sunshine market.

b-ZQfdPNDNU0h_tCuPOPDg.text: Great atmosphere.  Great food. Quaint.  Hidden gem.  Original cocktails. The beet ravioli was delicious and the shrimp piri piri was fabulous.  And don't the forget the cheese curds ,melt in your mouth.   Enjoy

75yHEjETIb34KV0ayhYODA.text: I'm disappointed to have to write this review. I've been to the Tuck Shop several times, and have always had great experiences in the past.  However, I just tried to make a reservation for my dad's birthday, and they wanted me to PRE-PAY $20 PER PERSON, PLUS 20% GRATUITY, PLUS TAX.  Are they insane?!?!  To make a reservation at your restaurant for 4 people, you're asking me to pay you $102 and some change just to come through the door?  I see that you will apply this to my bill, however what if we don't spend $20/person, or if my service is horrible and I don't find a 20% tip appropriate?  In all my travels (NY, LA, London, Italy.....) I have NEVER had a restaurant ask to be paid ahead of time, just to hold the seats.  That, my friends, is the definition of insanity; and I don't feel like going to the asylum.  Hasta la vista Tuck Shop.

NNwYlVUCPk4k4cJCZQS90g.text: This establishment is a very unassuming house pretty much in the middle of a residential neighborhood covered on a few sides with trees. It's easily missed so I suggest using some sort of navigation. Also very important to note, this place is NOT open for lunch. As far as I'm aware it's a dinner only place, much to my chagrin. It's also not open Sunday and Monday.   A date and I split their savory cake and their potato skins to start. I believe she got the special, which by the way are always excellent, and I got the steak. The steak was a very good size and cooked to order, was a very enjoyable meal. Their dessert menu also changes frequently to stay fresh so you'll really have to go yourself to see what they have.   All the dishes are plated beautifully and the small interior lends itself to evoke a very intimate feel. I would highly recommend for any sort of special engagement or romantic date. Of course, there's also no stopping you from going with a smaller group of friends for some very very good American food.

3r0vjGGZhgn6nvsCDqv-Lg.text: Recently discovered this gem of a restaurant, and I am glad I did! Have been here for brunch and aperitivo, and both were amazing. The food at brunch was amazing, and the drinks were to die for. For their special apertivo, that they do during the weekends, I highly recommend the oysters. I usually don't go for oysters, but tuck shop has made me a fan. Will definitely be back again!

X_ESFHd33mReGusLQI7J4g.text: Really a great little restaurant.  Great cocktails and different infused alcohol.  The food was awesome.  We sat at the bar where the bartender was friendly.  We also talked to other patrons who had been there before.  They all said the food, drinks and service were very good and consistent!  Will go back again!  P. S.  We did have some difficulty finding it but with a little perseverance, we obviously did find it!!  Lol

g1hUpFj_wFCTZuPDs4zVrQ.text: Sweet neighborhood spot with a homey yet refined feel. They invite you to wait in the "living room" while your table is being prepared, complete with sofas and books. Great menu options with something to please everyone but not overwhelmingly large. Only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because the pork main dish was a little dry and too salty, but all other food was great. Good wine, cocktail, and beer list. Dessert was good too!

JlCL62jL9TIJ4fSJUkm7SA.text: Killer ambiance and solid food. Reservations highly recommended  Came here to celebrate my move to Phoenix on a friend's recommendation and was so charmed by the converted house in a residential neighborhood. Intimate space but it didn't feel crowded. Service was excellent (they have the most beautiful servers), and the shrimp piri was SO GOOD. Our entrees were great, but at that price point, I have had better in other restaurants around town. Still would definitely come back for a special occasion or much needed date night. Another plus - parking was easy!

Xt74NvLXrMt8h7yflmKP-g.text: This is a great neighborhood restaurant. The food and service are superb. The staff are super friendly and accommodating.

Nu7ewIbXhk5YSYs8tyw6kg.text: This place is literally my new favorite. Went here for brunch with a large party and the food was incredible. The chicken and waffles were the best I've ever had, my eggs Benedict was fantastic. Arguably even better than the food are the cocktails, every drink we got was absolutely amazing and reasonably priced for using good quality liquor. The service was also fantastic and the restaurant itself is adorable. My only regret is not going here sooner

y2zMh6V5edxuPPA58y9V3g.text: Made reservations and came here for Sunday brunch. They were out of chicken and waffles so we'll have to come back. We got smoked salmon and pork belly benedict both of which were delicious! The service was top notch. Ambience is cozy. Definitely recommend!

jjg8i2oEDhsU-W6vtD2iNg.text: What a delightful experience! From the moment we entered with a friendly greeting, the gracious service continued through delicious appies, mains, and dessert. Our server was so helpful, guiding us to some new favorites. We shared the beer-battered cheese curds, and garlic/baguette - both were magic. Then we wandered through the mac-and-cheese, beet side salad, roasted brussell sprouts with polenta (YUM!) to the ahi tuna (my favorite of the evening) and the steak with frites. That heavenly sauce on the steak.... wow. Our favorite dessert was the raspberry bread pudding - a True gem, but hey... the creme brulee was pretty darn good too. Thanks for a great evening - lovely wine & beer menu too.

uPfo7cwgzqzQeUoH69_KtA.text: The service was fantastic, the servers were incredibly friendly, the atmosphere is an incredibly wonderful. We had the sea bass special, and it was out of this world! The croissant bread pudding was to die for! Seriously one of the best meals I've had in Phoenix! What a wonderful find!

Gvawn8Rdl8BPkzbbrXihTA.text: Fantastic! Great little spot for a night out! We loved the Steak and the Arancini - mushroom risotto & spicy italian sausage! Dessert was the bomb as well (chocolate cake)! Wine selection and drink menu paired well with any dish. We will definitely be making this place a regular stop.

xGjt2Yv4JSOSigsDADEZoA.text: 6 of us enjoyed a superb dinner. We had 9 or 10 items off the menu, with lots of arms across the table while we shared and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Ordered a second cheese curd along with Crab Ceviche for my dinner because I didn't want to have to share it again! Lots of small plates to share and enjoy here, and the kitchen and wait staff shined brightly. Very gracious owner. Great vibe as the place filled up. You'll definitely enjoy yourself here.

cT_FpORyfUwCvCc-6A3lOg.text: Ten of us met for an after work dinner. We had the nice big table in the middle of the restaurant. The service was excellent! Wait staff was there when we needed attention but not pushy or in the way. Good recommendations, great specials of the day. The food was excellent!  We had a little of everything, and it was the clean plate club. No one left anything for later, except for the chicken and waffles which was a LOT! It was all good. The seafood special (Chilean Sea Bass), steak special (Filet) was cooked to perfection, lamb was amazing with wonderful polenta, ribs falling off the bone with excellent slaw, Spring salad was all raved about.  deserts were shared and a great way to top of a wonderful meal!

08jH70T_Hmuj_senoAROBQ.text: Yes!  Finally tried this place out and it was better than expected.  Such a cute and quaint ambiance and food was amazing!  Can't wait to go back!!!

aWQPU-ep5h52CUArx-25UQ.text: I had been wanting to try this place for so long and finally made a reservation for my birthday. On arrival the ladies at the front were very nice and welcoming. Once we were seated it took about 10 min or so to be acknowledged by the server. When he arrived, no hello, no welcome, no nothing he literally stood there. So my wife asked to order a drink and he just walked away, didn't even ask what I wanted. Another 10 minutes later or so he took our order but again we had to tell him we wanted to order he said nothing. But the weirdest thing is he went right over to the next table that arrived and was friendly, welcoming and explained the menu, very attentive. A few minutes later our entrees arrived. Again no word out of him, and we were still waiting for my wife's drink we ordered 30 min ago. Everyone around us that arrived well after us got their drinks. So my wife asked the server, when her drink would arrive, he said we are busy and just walked off. I'm not sure what we did other than just ordering our food and patiently waiting but the blatant disrespect to us was unwarranted. The food was excellent no complaints there, and the drink finally arrived when we were almost done. After we finished our entrees he put the bill on the table. Never asked if we wanted more drinks, no mention of any dessert menu or anything. But again he went to the table next to us and asked if they would like to see a desert menu. I don't know what else to say but this was possibly the worst waiter I have ever encountered at s restaurant.

xAGSp-c1y0tnoodWa68J4w.text: The Tuck Shop is AMAZING!!!!!! From the food to the service it's a very hearty thumbs up!  I took a dear friend to tea this afternoon for her bithday. She has very strict dietary restrictions to be both gluten and diary free. I called ahead to speak to Grace (Grace and Lee are the owners) and make sure they could accommodate what we needed. Grace was lovely from the get go saying they had done gluten free but not both but that they could make it work.  Make it work they did! I have never seen Shirley eat everything that was put in front of her! They made gluten free and dairy free scones, bread for her tea sandwiches, and a mini Victorian Sponge. They made diary free whipped cream,cream cheese for her sandwiches, and custard.THEN, they made an out of this world gluten free/dairy free strawberry cheesecake AND a dark chocolate ganache cake.  Grace and Lee having an amazing little place! I absolutely LOVE it!

SY4nxahAPLFWFV3zpM1Hkw.text: I love the way this quaint little restaurant is Tucked away in the neighborhood as if it's someone's home. Inside it is very updated and hip. The food is tasty and has fresh ingredients and creative new recipes which I can appreciate. We sat at the bar for an after work meeting and tried a few appetizers in addition to having dinner and dessert. My favorite was the fried cheese curds. Overall, everything was good and I would come back for a nice hearty dinner with delicious seasoning.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dates appetizer
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackened Albacore (special of the day)

MS7B6jcy4vv0PoJyExElzw.text: Oh the Tuck Shop. I love you, let me count the ways....   This tucked away gem was recommended to me by my Realtor and the owners of the house we just purchased. Both live in Coronado Historic District and are self proclaimed foodies. Being a foodie myself I thought to try this little place, that is easily missed if you don't look hard enough.   I was greeted at the door by a very sweet gentleman. I have to say that my food experience starts with hospitality. If I am ignored or spoken to in a condescending manner my perception of the experience is affected. Everyone in the restaurant treated us with respect and offered a smile. I really like the atmosphere they create with their generous hospitality.   The food at the Tuck shop is stellar. We decided to have a sampling of appetizers so that we could try many of the options. Their menu seasonal, so you may not be able to have the same options if you are visiting any time other than summer.   We shared the stuffed dates, pasta fries, and lobster mac and cheese. All of the selections were really wonderful. This is comfort food! The dates were stuffed with cheese and chorizo, the flavors balanced well and it was complimented with a tangy green salad. The pasta fries were so good that they were gone in 10 seconds flat. We literally inhaled them. The lobster mac and cheese was great and the flavors and textures really worked together.   If you are in Historic Coronado you should really try this restaurant. I am totally impressed with their brilliant food and service.   5 stars!

phIOtMopNPdw74iNKjm_ww.text: The Tuck Shop was our restaurant for the last 6 years...warm and welcoming.  They changed ownership recently and I was hoping it would continue to be our go-to place.  We went there tonight with an open mind and open heart, but unfortunately we were sadly disappointed.  Upon entering, we were asked if we had a reservation (we did not) and the host said he would see if he could seat us.  The restaurant was almost empty and that is in plain view of all.  I wanted to leave then but thought they may have reservations coming in at any minute to fill it up.  Nope.  Only one couple came in the entire time we were there.  All the former staff is gone  except our favorite waitress Jenny.  Thank goodness for one bright star in an otherwise dismal evening.  The ambiance is what the Tuck had going for it, and that is gone.  I'm writing this review to let the new owners know that if you're going to make it in this neighborhood you need more warm and welcoming (think Cheers) and less haughty and austere.  I'll give you another chance when I hear you've gotten your act together, but until then I will take my business elsewhere.

r5o1miCehrs_XIsePcPXPA.text: I love the neighborhood vibe. It is a great restaurant for group dining. I had the yummy chicken and waffles.

BGj5RlpwB8VfVQxLqaYPzg.text: I Dont get the hype. Price of food for what is taste is just meh. A lot more places to enjoy.

v9T7_fw9m_jjw3vnzf1SiQ.text: New favourite spot in Phoenix. The perfect place for a special evening. Great food, quaint atmosphere, and perfect service. Will be coming back.

-fN-ITCRY0C5VuNPgccHrQ.text: Great little spot in Phoenix! My boyfriend and I came here after work one day for a few cocktails and some food.  They had an amazing special that was $39 for a four-course-meal for two.  Everything we had was so delicious! Neither of us could stop eating the jalapeno cheese curds nor the macaroni and cheese; both were very cheesy, heavy, and just the right portion.  The filet mignon was tender and the cut was a little thinner than it's supposed to be, but still very good for the price.  For dessert, we had their cheesecake, also delicious.  They seem to change up their menu frequently so the dessert items are often different.  The cocktails there were also fantastic.  I'm a huge lover of a well-mixed drink with balanced flavors, and this place had it all.  The negroni was right on par with what it should taste like, and their whiskey sours were nothing like either of us had ever had.  I would definitely recommend the whiskey sour to anyone that goes there, because it is a must-try!  All in all, nice, quaint atmosphere with a very interesting arrangement of furniture that resembles a living room in one part, great food, and excellent service.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of the best whiskey sours I&#39;ve had!!!
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Jalapeño cheese curds

PnZy4dUjMTLRlC-SswkUlA.text: Wow!  I was really surprised by the food here!  My wife and I were invited here as part of a group celebration.  What a perfect place to host a small party!  As you are driving to the Tuck Shop you feel as if you are going to get lost.  However, we found it easily though based upon mapquest directions.    The atmosphere is interesting and unique.  My wife loved the decor, and it felt very comfortable.  I found it funny that a few people were confused by the sliding restroom doors and thought it was appropriate to use the bathroom in full view of anyone happening down the hallway!    I still remember the taste from a few standout dishes that night....mmmmm.....filet mignon and shrimp dish.  I'm not sure if we had a special menu for our group, or if the menu changes frequently, but I didn't see some of the items we ate when I browsed the menu on their website.    I have to go back again soon!

VrlZFR1Kd6ElDhWQ5XFP2g.text: Amazing Comfort Food - quinoa cakes, cheese curds, white cheddar rosemary chicken and waffles...perfect 10!!  We'll be back!

Iy5MR_dryZhlZuqhUQlXlQ.text: I cannot fully describe the amount which I love this place.  I mean, it's literally around the corner from my house, so it gets extra awesomeness for being so close!  They make the best Pimms No 1 cup here.  I LOVE it.  I'm picky about how mine taste and here it is divine.  They also have housemade lemonade and ginger ale, which makes the world a better place as well.  John is awesome.  We love him.  They have weekly desserts which is awesome.  Always based on seasonaility.    Also the menu just changed for the summer season.  We have yet to try the new items, but have heard from friends that it's amazing.   LOVE LOVE LOVE

_ls27GP6U3PIHze1a0qJQA.text: I have totally fallen in love at Tuck Shop.  Everything here is fantastic.  My friend and I come here about twice a month and enjoy some snacks and wine.  The beer battered Cheese Curds may just change your life for the better... we are seriously tempted to each get our own order.   (I am not very good at sharing and i always get what I want!   ...No i'm not an only child... well, maybe I was until i was 11, how did you know.  WAH!)     Oh, and Laura is fantastic.  She always takes great care of us as we enjoy a glass of wine on the couch in the reading room.    Thursday's special is meat loaf... don't deny yourself, just indulge.  :)

l-Hg4AcgXijx2RPhXUrGuw.text: This is one of those places I find myself thinking about going to for no reason!  Very nicely appointed, great food, good service!  The fried cheese curds are sooo good!

sVZSn8lUSyDvStc4wLlKFw.text: I want to spend all of my money eating at the tuck shop. Not sure if these are still on the menu, but their beets...what the what? I looooove beets now. Everything we tried during their last season was outstanding--mac n cheese, chili, shrimp po'boy. Healthy people will enjoy the portion sizes; girthier people will not.  Can't wait to return for the summer menu.

CB91GmcOFUkFEDlBM_MSlQ.text: Found this place through Yelp and a Yelping buddy so there you have it...the power of Yelp because we absolutely LOVED this place.  Tucked into a neighborhood you have a very cozy, eclectic little joint.  From the start to the end we received extremely friendly service. We of course tried the foods suggested in previous reviews and by the server.  The pasta fries were unique, light and paired with great tasting sauces.  A definite dish you have to try.  We also tried the figs stuffed with chorizo.  Also very good & savory.  But the ABSOLUTE FAVORITE of the night were the chicken and waffles!  My gosh is this the dish to come to the Tuck Shop for.  The chicken was deliciously seasoned and had the perfect fry on the outside and moist chicken on the inside.  The waffles were served with a butter that seemed to be whipped with possibly honey and the syrup was just the right sweet.  All the flavors seemed to work with just the right amount of sweet and savory.  The grilled fresh green beans were the perfect side.  I think I would get this dish over and over and over again.  Then I would go back and get it again.   Great place we will frequent often.    P.S. They make their own tonic.  Yep, their own tonic.  GREAT tasting!  Try it with the vodka they serve (haven't heard of it before but was very pleased).

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pasta fries. Jalapeño Strawberry sauce. Yum!
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuck Shop Homemade Tonic &amp; Vodka

tw_uIBYY6Ey1EzTYsON7vg.text: The chicken and waffles were awesome. The Mac and cheese with lobstah (lol) was to die for. The scallop caprese is a great starter.

dZ_QzKutMsklRrXEy7S5uQ.text: Ventured to the Tuck shop with a girlfriend Friday night after hearing from someone random about this place.  First off, loved the small restaurant, cozy trendy vibe right off the bat.  Since it was a Friday night, we did have to wait a few minutes for our table, but luckily the host came over and offered to get a glass of wine for us.  He offered some suggestions... I liked mine, my friend did not.    As far as the food is concerned, I enjoyed almost ALL of it.  We decided to try several of the small plates/appetizers.  So, we had the crepes, cheese curds, the salad with avacado, and the dates.  The crepes were awesome as were the dates.  The cheese curds were a bit salty, but still very good.  I liked the salad, but it didn't blow me away by any means.  At the end of the meal we shared the apricot cake, which I found to be very dry, but my friend REALLY liked.  I will be back for sure.  I want to try that chicken everyone is raving about as well as the mac and cheese.  This is a fun, unique spot for some noshing and drinks!

oH0_rT_OG5eME_DYBCPvPg.text: Wow...we really had a GREAT night at Tuck Shop. I am so close to giving 5 stars but i'm going to save that for my next visit. We (our little dinner group) went armed with an appetite and having read other YELP reviews for inspiration. We weren't terribly surprised that there was a little wait even on a Wednesday night. But we went into the Reading Room and waited until our table was ready. Just about everything about this restaurant feels good. The location in historic Coronado....very neighborhoody and the converted house coupled with the great decor...everything tells you that you are going to get a great meal. Unpretentious and just plain delicious.   If there is any personal issue it is that our waiter let us order a stupid bottle of Pellegrino and didn't talk us into the "plain" water when indeed the "plain" water was the yummiest cucumber water I've ever had. Now personally I am partial to cucumber water...feels very spa-y to me. Can't get enough of it...so it would be my preference.   Our waiter David was darling....very sweet and humored us all night...we like to all try a little of everything so we tend to share everything three ways. A manager-ish person who didn't introduce himself asked how we were doing which is always nice...makes it seem like they care...always works for me in any case but my friend thrust the bill and credit cards at him not realizing it wan't David which he took without a hesitation and did as he was told..I laughed..my friend didn't.   But to the food. We had the Cheese Curds...OMG!! Enough said...how can you go wrong with beer battered deep fried cheese?? And yet after trying these I realize that any other fried cheese products that have been passed off as such for my whole life were frauds! Pure and simple! I'd been duped. This was heaven in a little ball of high calorie-high fat goodness!  On to the chorizo stuffed dates. Simply divine. Wouldn't change a thing. I could eat nothing but an order of that alone! Well...maybe two.   Nosh Plate- Most excellent. A Great combination of flavors, textures...the onion jam which was also described as plum jam (I don't know what it was...except delicious) mixed with the lavosh and havarti...Fantastic!   There was something with roasted veggies and hummus. It was great. Absolutely nothing to change.   Then we shared an entree of fried cod or some kind of fish? Idk...i didn't get it. I don't care for white fish much...i found it bland and a bit dry. My friends raved...and loved it...so based on the rest of the night...i'm sure it was just me. So...never mind...  Dessert...shared the molten lava chocolate cake and a blueberry cobbler. The cake was good...mind you we ate every single morsel. But quite frankly...you could get the same thing in any restaurant in town...i wasn't blown away. The cobbler was a bit too doughy-bready for my taste. The bluberries felt and tasted frozen even though I know they weren't because I overheard the story about buying them at the fresh food market from a grower in California or some such whatever....in any case...didn't love it....but quite frankly every single other detail was so fantastic that i'm certain we will go again and again.

JxM36EFHI7W_-PIF19oEew.text: There's really no point in going over all the details of my experience.  If you dig creative minds bringing their A game then you'll get it.  If you're really lucky you'll have a brief wait in the lounge before you're seated.  Bravo.

ktwjUUXfLb0UOkNX-FwX5w.text: 5 stars if the place would stand out anywhere - it would.  Many adaptive re-uses to get to today and a wonderfully comfortable "little plate" restaurant where you can dine bench-style and meet strangers if you're so inclined.  It served as a postal credit union and traveling carnival workers union safe house among its prior incarnations...  The chef is an artist and the prices absurdly low.  We stopped in for a light dinner at 9PM on a Saturday night - and were the next in line.  Many of the diners had biked there - the long bike rack was jammed,  Several people after us enjoyed the living room waiting room, others the big screen TV at the bar while awaiting a table.  Three of us - ordered 2 small plates and the sharing special.  It was just enough - any more and we would've been too stuffed.  11 bucks each before tip.  Toasted baguette covering melted brie and walnuts, accompanied by shaved veggie crisps, potatoes and parsnips frites accompanied by mushroom soup [they called it gravy but that implies flour and fat], pork and beef ravioli in a heavenly roasted tomato sauce.  Finished with chocolate chip cookie dough balls - desserts were sold out.  I could eat here every day...

0fB-q6XEuxmDzoY1860fcw.text: Cheese curds, chicken and waffles, Mac N Cheese with lobstah, oh the list goes on and on with this amazing restaurant. Nestled in the cute Coronado Historic District, the Tuck Shop has once again struck a positive cord with this Yelper. I've been here 3 times and have yet to be disappointed. The service is excellent and the food is to die for! Their chicken and waffles rock, although I will say that LoLo's edges them out on the fried chicken part, the cheddar crusted waffles and the corn and pineapple medley are superb! I will be back again and again and again and again and again and again and again......you get my drift

zt3uQI3hRKH3Zcca8K9XhA.text: What a great little find! Tuck Shop has been on my radar for awhile because of Yelp, so when a friend suggested trying it, I jumped at the chance.   First of all, I really liked the atmosphere. There was nothing particularly outstanding about it, but it just had a cool and cozy vibe. The service was awesome - we had a really nice waiter and a couple other people checking on us through out the night.   The menu is designed for sharing - which I love to do, so my friend and I ordered a several dishes. We each had a salad. I had the Chicory Salad (hazelnuts, roasted squash, endive, and desert honey-chestnut buttermilk). It's not that often that I go crazy about a salad, but this one was exceptionally delicious. I loved the roasted squash and the dressing had a very slight spicy undertone (cayenne?) that was so good. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. My friend had the Baby Lettuce Salad (avocado, fennel, orange-pomegranate vinaigrette) which was very good, but she was jealous of mine.   We shared the finger sandwiches (brie, honey, walnuts); fries and gravy (parsnips & potatoes with melted gruyere and a mushroom gravy dipping sauce); the mac and cheese. All were good, but I'd probably only order the mac and cheese again.  All this with a glass of wine made for a pretty great meal. I'm excited to go back!

_xd5QWs1asHhQ0AdzqjWjw.text: It's been too long since I've eaten here. I love this place. It's cozy, relaxed and stylish. I The one and only critique is that I wish their menu had more options. However, everything that I've tried is delicious. I love the dates stuffed with chorizo and manchego cheese.    If you haven't tired Tuck Shop, you should :)

HW6Rad0ggQtDnD3hdBQeJQ.text: First read about this in the recent 2009 Best of Phoenix and wow, what a great choice! The place is cozy and friendly (laidback atmosphere) with food that is a wonderful culinary experience. I enjoyed the roasted garlic in olive oil with the toasted baguette slices from the start menu, though the nosh plate might need some work (more types of cured meats, and maybe some of those tiny dill pickles).   From the starter plates we had the crostini duo and the roasted grapes and brie on the multi-grain bread slices was popular with all - the one with the cucumber slices on them, a distant and less exciting second. The other starter - dates stuffed with homemade Chorizo and grueyer cheese, yum! The come on a bed of greens with some sort of vinegar dressing, which was a nice compliment.  For Sharing Section of the menu - the citrus brined fried chicken and cheddar cheese waffles, loved by all! I recommend ordering it early since we asked for it about 7 pm and it was the last one left. Even the braised greens were good. I was not so impressed with the halibut filet plate  - nicely seasoned but frankly, a bit dry.  Other thoughts - they really like cucumber here - they put it in the water (makes it quite refreshing), garnished my gin and tonic with it (homemade tonic, nice but not really wowed by it), and had it on the previously mentioned crostini duo plate - just seemed like a lot of cucumer. As for the service, it was good throughout the meal. The waiter kept things well paced and was a good source of information when asked, without being overly obtrusive.  If you haven't gone, worth checking out and if you have gone worth going back again. :-)

P9jCTcInTLXITCTtA2PdgA.text: Tuck Shop my new fave restaurant!  Love the atmosphere.  Waited/chatted in the living room with my friends and a prosecco before being seated.  First visit was solo at bar enjoying zucchini planks, nice red wine recommended by owner/manager Grace Unger, a prosecco, and a lovely creme brulee that two people should eat.  Enjoyed talking with friendly bartender Max.  Second visit with two friends who were very pleased with every aspect of the experience--we loved the ambience and the ribeye and salmon dinner specials were cooked to the perfect doneness.  My friends plan to return.  Service/attention by owners Lee and Renate Unger and his team was excellent.  Saw him visiting with everyone.  Third visit with a workmate just as great.  Lee was prompt with getting us rose proseccos while we waited briefly in the comfy living room to be seated.  Lee recommended gnocchi, soy glazed pork belly, chicken and waffles and filet mignon from menu.  We chose to split pork belly with fries salad and chicken and waffles.  We were not disappointed!  Loved the combo of pork belly with fries salad.  Huge pieces of chicken and huge waffles.  Grace brought us a rose (?) that she thought would go well with the pork belly--great choice.  Georgia Unger was friendly and attentive to us the entire evening along with waitresses Marni and Deja.  Recommending to all my friends!

SzCPWiF6S2NqBDP-d0d-gw.text: The "comfort" food available is delicious. It's not your typical restaurant with its unique twist on neighborhood food. The service was great and very attentive. The decor was simple but interesting and didn't distract your company but allowed for an interesting conversation piece. The cocktails were made carefully and tasted delicious. The only problem I had was that the menu wasn't vast and that it was a bit pricey. If you're with a picky eater, check the menu out before sitting down. Personally, I don't like the hours since they are tight but I understand them.

YEzpzRDYrsSt7Ag30oDDPQ.text: I  went here while in Phoenix on business a couple of months ago. I was looking for a good restaurant not too far from my hotel, and although this seemed to be in a weird location the food is great! I had the chicken and waffles, and it was delicious! Cheddar waffles...  crispy deep fried chicken... it was amazing! So rich and decadent, but a perfect treat after hiking Camelback.   I also had their chocolate cake which was good, but not particularly memorable.  They also serve cookie dough balls at the end of the meal. Ours were stale and tasted like they had been in the fridge too long. I think they would stay fresher and taste better longer if they were dipped in chocolate.

NXGhw5uX4v_2W_7pVGUVRQ.text: I must confess, this review is way way over due. And there is not excuse, though if you would accept that the dog ate my review I might try and tell you that is exactly what happened. In actuality I was looking through my reviews today and noticed this one was never written.  The hubby and I went to tuck shop in November. Yup, that long ago. We stopped in before enjoying the art walk. I'm a really big fan of the location, I love all the historic homes, any excuse to drive through these lovely neighborhoods works for me. And the building they are housed in, beautiful. I really love how they set this up. The dining room is lovely and I look forward to taking advantage of using the huge table in the middle of the dining room for a birthday or other celebration in the future.  Service was good, our waiter was very helpful and knowledgeable of the menu. I really love the bottled tea they served.  Now for the important part, the reason I am writing this review so long after the fact: the chorizo stuffed dates, covered in gouda. OMG. I mean really. OMG. These suckers are like little pieces of heaven. My husband and I could not get enough. Sweet and spicy and smoky. I now serve my attempt at them at every family gathering, I think they are making my mother-in-law start to hate me a little less, so special thanks for that Tuck.  We also had the cheese curds, another first, and they were good. And we split the rib dinner. Those ribs, oh boy, the meat just melted off of the bone in the absolute best way possible. My husband was none too impressed by the cole slaw, but its hard for any cole slaw to stand out in a meal like that.  My only gripe, like some of the other reviewers, is the price to portion ratio. We only had four of those mind blowing dates, which would be fine, if the price was better proportioned to the size. I felt a tad bit taken on the ribs also, again small portion for the price. This is the only reason I haven't been able to talk the hubby into another visit as of yet.

Eo4yk-mYX83MV0YXGj3uvw.text: We visited Tuck with a group of 9 recently.  We ate mostly the small plates and enjoyed everything.  We sampled the dates stuffed wtih chorizo, oyster popover sliders, roasted garlic, spinach salad and mac 'n cheese.   All were tasty and nicely presented.  The place it self is cozy and comfortable with more elbow room then other downtown establsihments.  The service was friendly and efficient.  The noise levels allowed for covnersation without straining.  I would definitely go back there to try some entrees or again with a group

813fRhw-EBQiX41_3aCj5Q.text: Whoever said this place is good for groups and wheelchair accessible has seriously never been here. Its super tiny, crowded together mis-matched uncomforable chairs, nothing you'd want to drink. Its a overly hyped up, over priced - neighborhoody place that I would never return to - but if you into that, go. But its clean and the service was decent. My favorite moment had to be the guy that was upset because all his small plates came at once, Really?

3DIUvs302GEUO33AdzHILQ.text: So good and original. It's in the middle of a neighborhood which is cool. Highly suggest if you'r elike me and don't know what to try when looking for something new. Worth the cost, always solid service too.

qhzyLQuyPQ61Vad0LVBSiw.text: Everything was fantastic for my birthday dinner at the Tuck Shop.  Friendly staff, drinks mixed with care and great wines, lovely, calming atmosphere, and great food.  I got the skirt steak, which was as tender and tasty as I've had.  Our party of four tried three appetizers and three entrees, and they were all creative and delicious.  Nothing boring about this place.  And I didn't feel too guilty about being treated to dinner out--it wasn't terribly expensive.  Prices seemed appropriate.  The small bar looked like it would be fun to chill out at, so I might try dinner at the bar next time if they allow it.

NR3lyqmVXGiPRUZmx_EL-Q.text: I really enjoy this place. Really love the space. I'm not a fried chicken and waffle fan typically- but you have to get it here. The waffles are to die for.

talN3xf1597DcD-9qCalUA.text: Awesome place! Great menu, people and atmosphere! Even the water tastes unique, loved everything on the menu, wanted to try it all. Can't wait to go back.

2fVQsQDarW6IfG2pEusSBQ.text: What makes me feel better about being another year older?  Perfectly cooked beets in a mustard cream sauce.  Thanks, Tuck Shop.    I had attempted to eat here a few weeks previously, but, unbeknownst to me, it was the Coronado Historic District Neighborhood Festival-- and the regretful host informed us the wait was an hour and a half.  The courteousness of the host, the brief peek I had of the interior that night, and a quick scan of their menu online when we got home secured it as a top choice for my birthday dinner, and by making my reservation for 12 a week in advance, we were in!  Because there were so many of us, we were able to order quite a few dishes and trade around-- a practice that the waiter had greatly encouraged when we ordered by saying the dishes were served 'family-style' and meant for sharing.  For that descriptor, I expected bigger portions, but they turned out to be closer to a sizing I generally prefer-- moderate. The quality was excellent, well-chosen flavor pairings, and everything had that great homemade quality-- nothing came out cookie-cutter style.    I was very interested in the cheese and chorizo stuffed Medjools, but as I'm a vegetarian-- I opted for the Fontina & Pear Panini plate. We even received an interesting tip from our waiter while gorging on the slab of chocolate decadence we ordered for dessert-- bleu cheese to break the palette and offset the sweetness.  Not bad, definitely for the adventurer.  The only thing I would have passed on was the cookie dough ball parting taster.  Their presentation was lovely, four or five little dough balls drizzled in chocolate-- though in the end, I've had better raw cookie dough (I've been spoiled by Wanda's Magical Cookie Dough from Sack's for 6 years now) and it didn't quite live up to the rest of the fare.  But hell-- they were free.

dlx91XAUQeKC5kWOE0xL6g.text: We went last night and sat at the bar.  Good cocktails and a nice wine selection. They have hooks under the bar for your bag which is always a bonus in my book.  Started off with the chorizo stuffed dates.  They were tasty.  We ordered the pork loin and Vovo's special which were raviolis stuffed with beef and pork with a vodka sauce.  The pork loin was seriously tasty.  Lick the sauce from the plate kind of tasty.  Was one of the best restaurant meals I have had in a long time. You won't be disappointed if you order it.  The ravioli on the other hand was flat in my opinion.  Just overall needed more seasoning.  Groovy local atmosphere.  We will go back.

N4eEZ3TVEMnrOdnSTHQwPw.text: Chicken n' Waffles. There was a man sitting across from me that I almost did not claim as my husband, because of the utter pleasure he was taking in the fried chicken. To quote him "I am not sure that I can ever eat fried chicken again after this....it was just too good."  The hallowed chicken was also married with a savory waffle and grilled green beans. Flava Flave! That was the end of our meal...and to be frank everything else was pretty damn tasty. One more quote from the old ball and chain "if you can make SALAD tasty, you know what you are doing!"  Starters were cheese curds that are battered and deep fried and so they ooze out and send wonderful cheese into a blissful place....ok don't start me on cheese. Then crepes filled with chicken and caramelized onion (oh how I love a savory Crepe). Mac and cheese was so so good....and dates stuffed with chorizo on a bed of arugula. It was the perfect mix of sweet, spicy, and savory all at once. The atmosphere and service also gets two big "hollas" but to be honest, serve me this food on a busy intersection and I would be happy too. Rocks.

MoYTLNTR24bCOTke7Brvbw.text: Went here on Yelp's recommendation and agree the quality of the food was good. There wasn't enough of a variety for me and I'm used to more healthful, lighter food. The brussel sprouts melted in our mouths, the Mac and cheese was so much better than the usual but just as bad for you, and the pork tenderloin had great flavors  but was overcooked.. The dessert special was a chocolate cheese cake which was delicious but honestly too rich for me. If you want truly comfort food, I would recommend it but there are no options for people who want lighter fare.

-AbfZI3eAq5ORfV8ibqa9g.text: We stopped in to the Tuck Shop on Saturday night. We were pleased to be seated. We ordered Gin and tonics. They make their own tonic. My partner asked for Bombay with a wedge of lemon. He was told they have one kind of Gin and it comes with a cucumber, no substitutions. You can't have your cocktail with lemon. Is this the soup Nazi's new place? The waiter brought a plate with a lemon wedge but he almost seemed afraid that he would be caught. The drink tasted like cucumber he didn't want to drink it. We had a few small plates nothing great everything was extremely salty or extremely sweet. I think the chef has a problem with his/her palette

0wZpZqjo1ITFKEJ68A2utw.text: Plenty of parking across the roundabout, excellent drinks (they make their own tonic...a gin and tonic will never be the same for me again!), and delicious food!! Shared a couple plates with my friends and loved everything we ordered. From a girl who doesn't really like cheese, I loved the mac and cheese, nosh plate (the havarti was amazing and the sweet onion jam was unexpectedly delish) and the gnocchi was spot on. Definitely will return once they reopen for summer.

GCJF_vefexPIOeBs13O4FA.text: This place is amazing!  Every friend I bring here loves it.  The food is great for sharing and the drink specials can't be beat.  Great for a date or a crowd.

Rl18TC0NcmYGBed_9N4D3A.text: Had a night out with great friends while grandma watched the baby and couldn't pick a better place!!! Great service and everything we ate was superb. Very nice atmosphere.......amazing drinks. Can't wait to go back!

MIKeV8yGAPZHRBG8a_A80A.text: Love Tuck Shop! The restaurant is such a hidden gem in PHX. Always have had excellent service and food here. The tuna tartare is the best app - so tasty and the right amount of spice to it. Also would recommend the steak. Can't wait to come back!

6MZkF63od3INfQ04QJsMvg.text: We went for brunch totally generic food at ultra high prices. Not sure how it gets this much praise

IDYS_vEXEcCKy7hzQjke5Q.text: Like! The pork belly Benedict's are delicious. Bread is toasted and crispy. Coffee is good and they have a full bar. Staff is super friendly.

dlDGkmQCOZzyeVihaFFnXw.text: Perfect dinner experience!!! That is the only thing that needs to be said for my night out with family for dinner. The Yelp World though demands more info and I owe it to all to post more.   While working with family at the local home show, my father instructed me to find a local spot that provided a more upscale dining experience. Tuck Shop immediately came to mind and I gave them a call.  A very nice gal informed me that they were booked at the time I requested but would call if anyone cancelled. Lucky for us, someone did and dinner was on.  We arrived at 6:30 pm, were greeted by the same great gal from the phone and dinner service began. Here is a list of the amazing food we enjoyed:  Charcuterie Board: Cheese and meats of course. All was tasty and the accompanied grilled bread was so good. Ordered extra given how tasty it was.  Stuffed Medjool Dates: Schreiner's chorizo with gruyere. Yep, dates and they were awesome.   Sweet Soy Glazed Pork Belly: OH MY GOSH, SO AWESOME. It can be so hit or miss when ordering pork belly, but TS nailed it. It was served with a little frisee salad that really went well. Just perfect.  Beet Crudo Ravioli: Chilled beets, cheese, tomato sauce. Refreshing. Decent but not my favorite.  Grilled Rack of Lamb: Miso glaze with broccolini and polenta. AMAZING LAMB! I am not even a huge lamb fan but it was suck on the bone amazing. So glad my father shared and will be back for this dish for sure.   Pine AZ Spiced Steak: Mashed Yukon Potatoes and mushrooms. Tasty dish but after having the lamb, nothing could compete. Potatoes were so good and would ask for the potatoes to end up on the lamb dish when I go back.  Creme Brule: Sweet and creamy. Good dessert.  Raspberry Bread and Butter Pudding: Not sure if this was the name of this dessert, but it was one of the best I have ever had. The texture, the flavor, the whole dang this was so good. It had I believe a whiskey sauce that just rocked. Loved it.  In closing, an amazing meal in every way. Our waitress for the night was as good as they get, the setting was relaxing, and as you read, the dinner was perfect. If one goes and knocks out the pork belly, the rack of lamb with potatoes instead of the polenta, with the bread pudding for dessert, it could go down in anyone's top three meals of all time. Yep, that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cookie Dough Bites to go. Nice touch.
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crème Brule
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

MHyOHOF99gbL2AZVWAi2fw.text: Yes, this is our favorite restaurant to dine in Arizona.  I let you know what to order.    0) Drinks!  They have a rotating drink menu.  These are craft drinks.  I like a direct drink such as a manhattan so I'll usually look for something like that.  If i don't find something on their seasonal drink menu I'll just order a perfectly made manhattan.  I'll let the bar tender select the whiskey/bourbon/rye to inject. 1) Start off with the Cheese curds.  They are a must. 2) Tuna Tartare is excellent, we've always ordered this every time. 3) On a more recent visit we discovered the pork belly salad.  This is sooo good.

JKNrnHWQxOs7HuvVNcQ5_A.text: I expected more from the food and was really disappointed with our meal. I made a reservation for me and four guests that were visiting from out of town. Based on other reviews, not sure if it was an off night or what happened.  We started with the roasted garlic and brussels for appetizers. Garlic was okay, I've made better and same goes for the brussels. When you say goat cheese polenta I expect and neeeed goat cheese!! Sadly, it was bland.   The small plates sounded so good, we ordered a bunch to share for our mains. The salad, gnocchi, beet ravioli, tacos and a halibut special. Salad was the best thing we ate. Everything else was lacking flavor and felt uninspired. Disappointed I hyped this place up to my guests.

wj-deFvNWpIB4HhZAup5sg.text: Service was great. Cocktails great.  Warm inviting house environment.  Food was not bad, but also nothing to write home about, and expensive for what it was.  It might've been what we ordered but I was so looking forward to this after the reviews. We got the curds, which were good, 4 *.  I got the ceviche which was OK but nowhere near as good as the ceviche I've had during my travels, 3*. The stuffed dates were 4*. My boyfriend got the ribeye special which was $40 so steakhouse priced but not that way in terms of the quality of the cut or the preparation. He ended up asking for steak sauce, 2*. Oh well. We don't regret trying it but we won't be coming back.

7snmBwkFRA2XEUJfMS-Avw.text: This restaurant could not be any better! My family and I had dinner there on 4/6/2019, for my husbands birthday . For dinner we had the steak, portobello mushroom melt, St Lois BBQ ribs, and a Brussel sprout starter. Everyone raved about the food. The steak melted in your mouth as did the melt. The BBQ sauce was distinctive! We ordered a mousse pie to share and that too was heavenly! We will be back often. This is truly a special place.

pkYl3A9hRB9N7D9Z_Lwg_w.text: It had been two years since we last dined at Tuck Shop, so I figured that I needed a refresher course before conjuring up a review based on memory. Although interestingly enough, the restaurant has apparently taken new ownership since we last came here.  The restaurant itself is modernly-designed, although very small, with a wine-drinking/waiting area taking up a good chunk of restaurant space that could probably be used for more tables.   Honestly, if we didn't pay a revisit and I based my experience on memories and old pictures, I would have ranked the restaurant at an average of three stars. And during our most recent outing, I'd still stand by that.  Tuck Shop just isn't our kind of place, I guess. It's a restaurant that does a bit of everything where nothing really seems off limits. I don't know what you'd call it. American-Modern food that people seem to like calling "eclectic" or almost "quirky" in some ways. I can appreciate it, but prefer restaurants that have a bit more of a solid direction in what it is they're trying to accomplish.  They used to have some excellent house-made ginger ale that has since been removed from the menu. Pity, as I liked it so much on one visit that I actually requested a second one.  On our current and past visits, we've also had their cheese curds. Unlike the traditional cheddar, these seem to have more of a mozzarella-typed flavor to them. Personally, I found them to be a bit on the saltier side. Additionally, their roasted Brussels sprouts that include a honey goat cheese polenta was a bit more interesting in terms of flavor and creativity, but a dish that I'll probably forget we even ordered a couple of weeks from now.  Picking from their entrees and small places was tough. There's a lot of dishes that sound potentially interesting, while others are questionable (e.g. taco salad?). I always insist on ordering the times mac and cheese. Like the curds, it's always something that I want so badly to like, but always end up just feeling kind of blase about it.   For the main entre, we opted for a filet that they had on special, which included a mushroom sauce and the usual mashed potatoes and green beans. Overall, it was just okay. Much like the mac and cheese, it wasn't really any better or worse than any other steak we've had. We've had their chicken and waffles in the past, which we ended up hating. Infusing white cheddar into waffles is being different for the sake of being different. Some people like it - but we absolutely loathed it.  Dessert options include a creme brulee - which I've always labeled as a bit of a "cop out" dessert with modern restaurants. Their other options seem to continuously change, but we decided to pass on dessert for once. Although I do recall ordering a pecan pie a few years back that was decent.  For two starters, one small plate, and one entree, our bill came to 80 dollars, which seems a bit pompous considering we didn't order drinks. That's probably also another reason why there was a two year gap between visits.  On the plus side, the server was attentive and very polite. I really appreciate that, unlike many restaurants, they actually asked us the order in which we wanted our food served, enabling us to enjoy everything at our own pace without feeling rushed. I've often ranted about places that bring everything out at once. For this, I do give them credit.  Honestly, I can see why a lot of people like Tuck Shop. It's modern food with a creative flare. And although I wouldn't really call the experience anything spectacular, it's one of those places that I still recommend people try for themselves.

htcS0wQQ_1iHRXU0HlsVeQ.text: Absolutely fell in love.  We went for brunch and Dustin and Caitlyn explained the menu and cocktails with such care and thoughtfulness.  We had the crab-cakes benedict and chicken & waffles.  The chicken was drizzled in this amazing honey type sauce and cooked to perfection.  The staff was amazing, even encouraging us to take a group picture.  We had so much fun, loved the atmosphere and I can't rave enough about Dustin and Caitlyn.  You can tell they really love being a part of something wonderful.

Zfm86Yinaqy_MxcCk0NrfA.text: What a cool place for dinner. Service was awesome!   Food was creative and delicious. Decor and ambiance were relaxed, stylish and welcoming. So glad we found this place in Phoenix!

4KqVp30rk5vIq0XQZ8YKGA.text: What a Phoenix Jewel! Why is it that Phoenix gets the best restaurants?!! I've lived in LA and now Austin TX. I have not found places like the ones in Phoenix.

nPlRiQgpxEBcOH3pBCjVwA.text: Upscale, high quality food. A bit pricey but a good value for what you get. Cool location in an old house in a historic neighborhood. A unique, modern atmosphere that is somehow great for both intimate date night and for groups. They have large plates and small plates, with a good selection of heavier and lighter dishes, as well as vegetarian options mixed in. We ordered one appetizer and two small plates and it was plenty for the two of us. Our favorite is the roasted garlic appetizer. Amazing! Their wines are all high quality and their custom cocktails are incredible!

XDqo6Wlmhtl17BnulQgTdg.text: Tucked away in a residential area less than 5 minutes from our home. Found it on Yelp and read some conflicting reviews but wanted to try. Had a double date here on a tuesday night at 615.  Called ahead and they said we would have a table.  Service is spot on!  Menu is super fun with starters, small plates and entrees. We wanted to sample as much as possible so had the savory pancakes, zucchini crisps, mac and cheese (with lobstah), some kind of hot dogs, pork belly and street taco salad. It was just enough food for the 4 of us. Mac and cheese was rich. The pork belly had great flavor and the apple frisee salad it came with had awesome dressing. Can't quite figure out the savory pancake that comes with a greek yogurt dipping sauce.  The hot dog appetizer was good...it had some kind of beans on it too. Street taco salad was a bit creative but not a street taco?  Great decor inside with a fun vibe.  They have a spot that looks like a trendy hipster living room which was cool.  Bar area and tv.  Private parking.  Overall, good experience but wasn't impressed with the food.  Had higher hopes for the fun menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lobstah mac and cheese with bacon $17
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork belly with apple frisee salad $12

bP140USqB4ldojnsgg-uvQ.text: Went to TS for the first time in October 2018 having had this place on my radar for some time. I must say it felt like a bit of a let down. We had reservations and were promptly seated. The menu was interesting but hardly unique. We decided to order an appetizer, two small dishes and two mains to split at a table of three. Within 5 minutes every dish showed up at our table. My first reaction was "it is simply impossible all of this was made fresh in that amount of time" and I was right.  The chicken an waffles were simply awful: no crisp to the skin and frankly I should have known better than to order this.  The pork ribs were ok. The shrimp piri piri was meh. The best thing was the special which was a ribeye steak with asparagus but again the accompanying potato was stale.  Overall the food tasted like it was sitting in a keep warm for the last 6 hours which explains how they could rush all that food out so fast.  The result is that quality took a dive.  Sadly I won't be back to Tuck Shop any time soon.

ODMYtZ949ZtHXXhjbmuAUA.text: We went to the Tuck Shop for English Tea. For $35 a person you get each get 4 finger sandwiches, 2 small scones with Devonshire cream and jam, an assortment of petite pastries and of course tea. The best part was the tea itself and scones. The finger sandwiches were ok (the bread on 2 should have been fresher) and we were underwhelmed with the "dainty pastries".  Service was acceptable. We have had traditional English tea at many different places. Some that cost less and were much better. What came as a surprise is they automatically added a 20% tip onto the bill even though there we was only 2 of us.  I did not see any mention of an automatic gratuity on their website.

RycHxJlKsqaIGm1CjJ65rw.text: I wish I would have found this gem earlier in my Phoenix trip.  Eclectic, fun, and delicious.  Since I was dining solo, I sat at the bar and even though there was a loud group at the end of the bar celebrating after work, the bartender was super attentive.     I had a relaxing dinner, enjoying a glass of malbec and the Street Taco Salad -- al pastor con pina, grilled corn, pickled carrot, avocado crema.  Really delicious.  The bits of pineapple made the dish.  I wish I had been hungrier so I could have ordered more!  This might be out of your way, but seek out Tuck Shop!

Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Street Taco Salad -- al pastor con pina, grilled corn, pickled carrot, avocado crema

7Kmed80yFfa2K8aC-jnd0g.text: Stayed in the area in an adorable air bnb up the road and walked down to Tuck Shop for dinner. The Brussels are amazing to start. We also had the salad and tuna tartar which was also delicious. Atmosphere is very welcoming and service is friendly.

l5XBz0qy_fu8GIMcStxE_g.text: Always a delight!!  This place has got to be: The cutest with their waiting area/books/comfy couches The MOST friendly! Delicious food to boot! I can usually decide pretty quickly from a menu what I'm going to order through process of elimination but this place makes it tough because the whole menu looks good .   Also, this place is great for mixed company ie: meat lovers, bread lovers, GF, vegan, it has amazing menu items for any diet.

kcfD8kLQ8MC-Kmx4Xk7oTQ.text: We loved this restaurant. Went to the Phoenix Theatre Co for a show first, then had dinner here. We decided to share several small plates and one large plate. We started with the crab ceviche which was excellent. Homemade chips and so much flavor. Then we had the charcuterie board which was very good and flavorful too. Next, we shared the carne asada tacos which were also amazing. Finally, we ended with the chicken and waffles. Let me tell you, this was my first time having chicken and waffles and I am now a fan forever. They were delicious! We each had 2 drinks. The bartender made me a Mexican mule which was super tasty.
