rT6B1LAGy2lGC4MlHqFAUw.text: We here on a date with my boyfriend.  Cutest little dinner place, drinks and food were amazing, but the atmosphere takes the cake.

kptAYHstBDgUPJf8ZMvHkg.text: Great service, atmosphere and food. This is one of my wife and I's favorite places to eat in Phoenix.  I would highly recommend this place for a date night, or a special occasion.

CsPgQczQc_qcGyTbHNIQjQ.text: Whenever in Phoenix I always try to come here. Great service and smiles. Delicious food (starters, small plates and entrees). Great desserts,wine list and  cocktails. Reservations are recommended.

nyZ2d5077vC0ftB0KAGAGw.text: We thought we'd be back sooner than this and we were hoping for another good experience. It's was just alright. We ordered many small plates and each of us had an entree with sides. The menu changes so don't expect to get the food you see on Yelp in the photos.  Tuck Shop pursues an aggressive flavor profile on every dish they create, including side dishes, which isn't always a good thing.  It's like paying top dollar to listen to an orchestra where every player is a diva. The cacophony is deafening.  We still think Tuck Shop is okay, but this second visit only confirmed what we thought the first time, which is that Tuck Shop "over does" and "over salts" everything. We came here because our daughter requested it. We go out all the time and we would have taken a pass on this place, but it was what she wanted. We enjoyed the laid back decor, the cool, ambient music, and we thought our waiter was an adorable hipster. Tuck Shop just tries a little too hard for our taste.  Also, if there is one thing we do not like when going out it is when the wait staff responds to our inquiries with, "It's really, really good. That's my favorite." I don't want to know what a waiter likes. Taste is subjective. Just tell us what is on the menu and answer our questions without giving your personal opinion, because I'm pretty sure we don't have the same palate.  The cocktails are still very high quality. The fried chicken is still cooked to perfection. The green beans are greasy and way too salty--just like last time. Cauliflower gratin with grits was interesting, but had a sour note, and the brocollini it was paired with as sides was also greasy and salty. There is no excuse for that. Allow the vegetables to breathe for godssake.  You don't need to work so hard to make a good impression. This reminds me of the Mindy Kaling routine: a retarded person shows up to lunch an hour early...in a tux. We'd like Tuck Shop so much more if it let the food be great without over dressing every damn thing on the menu.  And why are you so above syrup for the waffles? For reals? I've had meals sitting in the same room where Reagan used to eat in Washington D.C., but I'm no snob. Waffles deserve some effing syrup. Sheesh. For a place that serves sickeningly sweet medjool dates stuffed with Gruyere cheese *and* spicy chorizo, it should be okay to drizzle maple syrup over a soggy waffle that's been baked with cheese inside of it. Strange thought processes going on there. You're trying too hard to be different.  BOTTOM LINE: Great atmosphere, nice/friendly service, good sized portions, fair prices on all dishes--just too much experimentation, grease, salt and seasonings. If you want chicken and waffles go to Lo-Lo's It costs the same but you get twice as much without the fanfare.

0Lz1_HlDOfvQ5WkpYQs1aA.text: Great food, customer service, music and overall a great vibe. My son wanted something they didn't have on the brunch menu and they brought him out a treat of the most delicious pecan cookie dough balls that made his day! My favorite thing by far on the regular menu is their chicken and waffles- they are amazing!

Yz0FDuD_xvMq6VNfFl6Caw.text: Went on a recommendation of my foodie friend Manny who definitely scored a home run!  There were 11 of us kids included and we had appetizers, multiple small plates and a couple of entrees that we all shared. Every thing we ordered was carefully constructed with the right amount of flavor and fresh ingredients and was a gastronomic delight. From the tuna tartar, the shrimp small plate, to the chicken pizza, vegetable ceviche, gnocchi, beet ravioli, mac n cheese with lobstah, chicken and waffles. You name it, it was great!  Definitely returning with an even bigger appetite!  How often does it happen where everything you order is delicious? The service was also great btw. Thanks Manny for your recommendation

u5rbLGP-TDsOVP31Mf_W6w.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Phoenix.  The Beet Crudo Ravioli is fantastic!  Everything on the menu is great, especially the small plates. The cocktails are great and I am a beer guy.  Lastly, and most important, the staff is phenomenal!

o1zzQxTxVGiWemhoSXIx4w.text: The cheese curds are the reason I go back. Seriously. They are light and fluffy and amazing, I don't know how they do it.  Nice setting, nice service, and the rest of the food is alright, though things sometimes sounds more exciting than they are, and it's a bit expensive for the amount of food you get. The small plates are really small, think sides more than tapas-sizing. For 2 smallish people, we've shared 1 appetizer and 3 small plates, or 2 appetizers, 1 small plate, and 1 entree--- and that still ends up being too little.

BpdkZKJZiI8iMc0Lg8Jwkw.text: Awesome experience !  We had traditional High Tea.  Grace is lovely and her daughteras well!    We were treated to pots of our choice of inhouse blended tea, towers of mini sweets and tea sandwhiches.  When word gets out about this High Tea Party you will not be able to get in.  The beautiful dishes, the traditions explained - top notch.  Grandpas recipe scones and the devonshire cream - I am craving right now!!  Definitely exceeded our expectations as we have been looking to have Tea for a few years.  Thank you so much for this experience!

PO90rt7VUuZcIAtoseDZsg.text: I really enjoy this local neighborhood restaurant. One of my favorite places in Phoenix. Excellent food and friendly staff.

d3fDCaRBfwWQTOH54cAfAA.text: Place is small, so make reservations if u want a private table. Otherwise, the food is excellent!!! Wine list is decent for a small restaurant. The service is good and the ambience is intimate. I will be back to try the rest of the menu

irzTzfiPA3B7dOZ6-5kzmQ.text: An appropriate English name as this restaurant is "tucked" inside a residential area in an unlikely, but inviting space. But there it is...this quaint and elegant place that seemed to crank out dish after dish of sumptuousness. The Tuck Shop on this hot, non-touristy summer night was filled with local patrons. I spied order after order of chicken with waffles pass me by and their fall-off-the-bone pork dishes, including their ribs and pork belly. We ordered both at our table and it did not disappoint. We started out with their cheese curbs that are lightly coated with bread crumbs and sprinkled with, I am guessing, Kosher salt. For dessert, we shared their wonderful creme brulee that comes almost as a double order. Oh, lest I forget, I ordered the tastiest cold soup; thickened by soaking bread into the broth and then using the blender. It was a red pepper stock that came with thinly sliced apples and crusty, thinly sliced bread. Delicious! Our waitress was both knowledgable and attentive. We found her to be genuine and a pleasure when she appeared at the table. The only suggestion would be to expand the wine selections, especially the Chardonnay as the only choice was pricey at, I believe, $13.00 a glass. Overall, this is not an inexpensive dinner if you include drinks, but the food is outstanding and we will return again! Bravo.

3BlWgRcCAcyRBJdoVmiScQ.text: Good place but they can do a lot better on having more vegetarian options. The atmosphere is really great. It is a bit pricey but the food is good. I'll return and hope they up their vegetarian options.

eN4fqS4zzinhVZR41oh5Jg.text: The Tuck Shop is the place to be when you're missing home. The environment is cozy, and the staff is nothing less than exceptional. The food is phenomenal, and there is always a delicious dessert on the menu! They also offer extensive vegetarian and gluten free options to those with dietary limitations. A great place to curl up on a couch, and order a cocktail crafted to perfection. What a place.

wucLo08pAlXTooy5Dh5kUA.text: Wonderful high tea experience.  The two varieties of tea were great and the finger sandwiches were amazing - I tried them all. The desserts were very high quality, not dried out like some places. I'll definitely go back for tea again!

8PICwi7yuF65if5N7a7-nA.text: Trendy little place tucked away in a cute little neighborhood.  The food in the pics PROBABLY isn't available. Be aware of that. Most of the stuff we saw on yelp and went for was not available anyway.  Chicken and Waffle - It's good. The Waffle was a bit soggy though, the chicken was delicious. Would be nice if they gave you syrup. When we asked for it we were sneered at and told the waffle had it inside it but they would bring us some. The Green beans on the waffle were a weird addition but AWESOME.  Lobster Mac and Cheese - Meh. Lobster was dry and overcooked and the mac and cheese was stuff with breadcrumbs and far from creamy. This was definitely not something we would order again.   Flank Steak - Would have and could have been good would they not have sliced it as soon as it came off the grill. The juices just ran out all over the plate leaving the steak missing a lot of flavor and juicyness. These guys do not have a clue when it comes to proper steak prep. Id never order a steak here again. It had no flavor whatsoever.  All in all this place was a disappointment after a 23 mile drive to try it. The only decent thing was the chicken and waffles and to be honest, we would go to Lo Los and pay half the price if we ever craved it again.

QSUZeHp4SHJGi6h05amgJQ.text: Tuck Shop... well, maybe up the dollar signs from $$ to $$$ but its all good, totally worth it. I love the living room vibe. Small place, really, really good cocktails and delicious food. Small portions, lot's of flavor and great service... I'll be back. Oh and if you need a place to hold an intervention... the side living room (actual living room) would be great.

xePeuU3yIcemvPBm_ljjlA.text: Tonight we (the girl and I) decided to bike around downtown checking out all the chic neighborhoods and dream of where we would live if we could. And we decided to end the night with dinner at Tuck Shop, which proved to be a good choice (as usual).  The ambience is great. The low, wood-paneled ceiling creates a very cozy feel. And the waiting area looks like a living room so you really feel your just going over to a good friend's house for dinner. My only (minor complaint) about the "over at a friend's house" atmosphere is the TV behind the bar.  You can't get away with having a bar AND no TV in this town (I understand), but I can still have a small complaint about it.  We started out sharing the cheese curds and the chorizo-stuffed medjool dates. The cheese curds were very tasty, although I wouldn't mind a side of spicy mustard or something. Perhaps red pepper jam? The dates were excellent. A perfect mix of spice and sweet, topped with Gruyere cheese.   I also added a brisket street taco on an impulse, and I'm glad I did. The brisket is cooked perfectly (which they do next door at their other eatery, Astor House). It came with a lime-cilantro-avocado sauce which was good, but I felt the sauce covered up the flavor of the amazing brisket.  Our main course (which was shared, as most plates are and should be at Tuck Shop) was the "Vovo's Favorite"- the special of the night-a half duck in a oyster and mushroom au jus, served with a sweet potato cake and grilled grapes. I felt like I was having Thanksgiving dinner all over again. The sweet potato cake was nice and light, and the grapes worked much better than I had expected. The flavor of the duck was excellent. The only problem with the dish was that the duck was a bit dry and tough. I usually expect a much juicier and fatty piece of duck, so I was a little underwhelmed with the texture. Overall I was pleased, and I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt on the duck.  Our server was pleasant and helpful, making sure our wine glasses stayed full. It's hard to beat the overall experience at Tuck Shop. Despite a few minor flaws with the food, I will keep coming back again...and again...and again.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The cozy inside of Tuck Shop.
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. &#34;Vovo&#39;s Special&#34; half roasted duck with clam and mushroom au jus, sweet potato cake, and roasted grapes.
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Medjool date stuffed with Schreiner&#39;s chorizo and gruyere, over salted arugula

ika7zM2fXqfSArNuJzm7qA.text: This was the second time my lady and I went to Tuck Shop. The first time we went we had a 5star experience because of the service and the food and after the second experience I felt like writing about it.  The food is unbelievable. We had the roasted garlic, pork belly, tuna tartare, pine steak, and the St Louis ribs. Every dish was excellent and I would have the exact same thing again but when I look at the menu I almost want to just hand it back to the waiter and say bring me what you'd like because honestly everything on the menu looks fantastic.   When the pork belly was served the owner of the restaurant made a comment that she thought the piece that came out was "too fatty" for her liking. My lady and I aren't pork belly experts so honestly I wouldn't have even noticed because it was very delicious but because the meal didn't meet the standards of the owner, she sent us home with one, with a very genuine note on the to-go box. And just to be clear, I'm not giving them 5stars because I got free extra food... this 5 star rating is because of the service.  We had a negative experience on this date. When our server greeted us he politely said "We are very short staffed tonight, so I am taking some tables and handling the bar." (This was the bar tender). His inexperience waiting tables showed, as he was easily distracted by other tables who were flagging him down instead of focusing on the task at hand and then moving to the next task. An example of this is as he was bringing our drinks to the table he turned his head to address another table and inadvertently dumped 3 or 4 ounces of a gimlet down the back of my lady's dress!!  Clearly embarrassed and apologetic he ran and got a moist rag. He apologized profusely and removed the cocktail from our bill. We were temporarily rattled and frustrated by this experience but at the end of the day he is just a human who makes mistakes like the rest of it. When mistakes happen I usually judge a man by his reaction to it vs just the fact that a mistake was made. He apologized, he admitted he made a mistake and he didn't blame anyone or anything else for it. Furthermore, the first thing he did was explain to us that waiting tables wasn't his primary responsibility so it's very understandable that a mistake could have happened. It's just an accident and they owned it. The owner apologized as well.   My lady and I will definitely be back and I know that if I ever need to impress work clients with a great meal this restaurant will be at the top of my list along with establishments like Fleming's and Ruth's Chris.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

5htOQnGGBx0tJflpCATtcA.text: How was I even living before tonight?! How could I have missed this place all the years I worked downtown? Why have I never been here before? These were all questions I asked myself the second we met friends here tonight for our first double date in forever! Our reservation was at 7 and within moments of getting there we were seated. Located right off 12th Street inside an old home it fits downtown vibes perfectly.  Cozy, great bar, romantic yet also cool enough to hang with friends. I loved that they had a little living room area with a couch and chairs while you wait for your table. We ordered s few drinks off their cocktail menu. My favorite was number 52 which was Herradura Blanco Tequila. Creme de Cassis. Lemon. Champagne. It literally came out picture perfect! No detail was spared from start to finish. Next we ordered the Charcuterie Board  to share while waiting on our main courses. There were so many great things to chose from, but I decided on the chicken and waffles. My hubby chose the St Lewis BBQ ribs. Our waitress was wonderful, never skipped a beat, was friendly and we never felt rushed in any way. Our food was amazing! I was worried a bit about trying the waffles because I've never tried a waffle with white cheddar, but oh my gosh....HEAVEN! Perfect savory and not overly sweet. I could've eaten them without syrup, but add a little maple syrup and awwww yum! Green beans were a perfect touch and were cooked perfect. Not soggy just perfect. The chicken was juicy, crunchy the right amount of salty. The Tuck Shop Nailed it down to the perfectly wrapped and boxed leftovers. Best date night and meal I've had in ages!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 52- Herradura Blanco Tequila. Creme de Cassis. Lemon. Champagne
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Perfect even down to the leftover box to take home
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. St Louis BBQ ribs

YGA9e8BYOzAgFCUIfk0Aew.text: Lovely Mother's Day brunch here this past holiday. To start off, my mother and I ordered the lavender champagne and the Mother's Day champagne special. The special was basically champagne. Nothing special about it. The lavender champagne, however, was quite lovely! Unique and just beautiful with the lavender color. Our brunches were all delicious. I had the steak and eggs, and my steak was cooked perfectly at medium. Was a very lovely place to celebrate Mother's Day. I will be back!

x8u5UlWfMEjUu5izcOZV9g.text: This wasy first time here and I must say they did not disappoint!!! I had the English breakfast and my wife the Eggs Florentine and we shared an order of Brioche French Toast.  It was exactly what I need for Brunch!!! Go check them out, you will love it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

yc7to6ef0a9jWljBoNmZCw.text: Best place ever!!! Dustin serves the best drinks in the valley and the menu is always changing. Grace is super friendly and always around to help us learn about a wine or rum, anything really. It's great whether you're looking for something to-go or excited to spend a night out.

qJUYJUXkisB96yvmdkExtg.text: My family loved it here as they celebrated a birthday. Unfortunately my cousin and I were both sidelined (he at home recovering from a hiking injury and me stuck at our hotel with food poisoning ef). The rest of the group raved about the food as well as the service!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Birthday girl

iruyKE4B1hhyyuPcjCWckw.text: Very disappointed with our Mothers Day brunch. We experienced the worst service ever. Our brunch took an hour from the time we ordered until it was served.   We had to ask 3 people every time we needed coffee refills. No one would bring sweetener so I got up and get some myself. The same with hot sauce. I ended up getting it myself from the bar.   We had to ask 4 times for the breakfast potatoes that were supposed to come with my sons breakfast. Asked 3 times for our side of bacon.   We were charged for soda waters that were never refilled.   We ordered Benedict's and the eggs were over cooked.   This was an awful dining experience. Awful.   On a positive note, I am blessed to have been able to spend the morning with my family.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not so poached eggs Benedict.

AJ1WoRAzMKCE_rs-ff1sfQ.text: Came here for brunch with a friend on a Sunday morning.  The place is pretty fun, big windows, lots of natural light, nice decor. I ordered eggs florentine and it turned out ok. The eggs and sauce were good but I was slightly disappointed in the breakfast potatoes. Not sure they were made fresh but they were also super overcooked.  I guess I expected a little more from the awesome pictures they have been posting.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Brunch menu

1dA60enLtqVV5ZOFyz3WIA.text: Such a cute tiny little place, it used to be a bank so it still has the vault which adds a cool touch to the atmosphere. I love that you can see the kitchen and watch the food coming out. The food is fresh and they make the gnocchi in house which is really good and taste so fresh. Everything that came out was presented very well and looked amazing. I would recommend getting reservations as there are not many tables and it fills up fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not sure the correct name of this but it was like a really light bread pudding type dish. It was really good!
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp piri piri is good and has some spice too it.
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tuna tartare is so fresh tasting and light, really good appetizer.

_znNEGxmEciphUlGZ918Zg.text: I had Tuck Shop bookmarked for a very long time due to the numerous rave reviews. I'm not sure if I ordered the wrong dish, but unfortunately I wasn't too impressed with our dinner experience.  After looking over the menu, there were quite a few starter & small plates that sounded really really good, but because we were super hungry, we settled on two large plates instead. I got the Chicken & Waffles and my husband got the Pork Loin.  I didn't really care for the taste of the fried chicken, it didn't really have any exciting seasoning & the waffles were just okay. Not at all worth the price. My husband enjoyed his Pork Loin, he said it was cooked really well & was super flavorful. I didn't snag a bite but it looked like a filling dish!  As I previously mentioned, I really do think I just got the wrong dish, which is why I ended up ordering a bread pudding dessert. That was good, a bit too sweet with the sauce but enjoyable. I'd like to return to try out some of their other menu options. I can see why others enjoy this restaurant with the ambiance, especially for a date night. Hoping to increase my review to 4, even 5 stars in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles / Pork Loin / Bread Pudding.

k8gWPlLDepoknYpammmsKQ.text: First timer here with a group of friends who were also first timers. We came for a Sunday brunch and food was so delicious. Those chicken and waffles tho. We were all very satisfied and can't wait to come back to try the dinner menu. The restaurant was so cute. We had the best servers ever. Katlyn and Dustin are awesome.  We couldn't believe we found a amazing hidden gem. We shall be back soon. Thank you for being the best guys :)

YyeOloCdROI8qmkKTos9FQ.text: This was my second time to Tuck Shop and all I can say is... YUM! It is family owned and operated and EVERYTHING is good. The first time we had the sausage breakfast (ask for the HP sauce for those British sausages, you'll thank me later), the raspberry bread pudding (yes, all kinds of yes), and the chicken and waffles, AM edition. Everything was just delicious, well prepared, amazing. Second time we tried the seasonal eggs Benedict, crab, with house made hollandaise...just hook me up to an IV please.  The atmosphere is chill, warm, homey, and inviting. It's tucked away in a cute historic district and is quiet and calm. Everyone was incredibly nice, and the owner is very kind! If you're looking for a good breakfast to top all breakfasts, this is the place. My new favorite for sure!

O9bnhkAn4I4yYdwSyJWKsQ.text: My favorite restaurant in Phoenix. They open for dinner at 5 and fill up very quickly. Reservations are highly recommended. The owner is often found at the bar, welcoming guests and chatting with them. Ambiance is modern-homey to romantic with old sofas in the waiting area. Service is very friendly, helpful and quick.  I love the small plates as appetites, like the stuffed dates and Brussels sprouts. The mac and cheese makes for a full meal and is rich in Bechamel sauce and bacon. The entrees vary frequently and have novel flavor combinations. My favorites are the lamb and scallops.  They have a good wine selection, local draft beer such as Four Peaks and an outstanding single malt selection.  On the desert menu, the creme brulee is a must try.  You can tell from the menu combinations and quality of ingredients that they actually love food.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bread Pudding
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Four Peaks Kilt Lifter
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Stuffed Medjool Dates

8eyN2SrjOK8iuDGS-7MO8A.text: Came here for Mother's Day and it was easy to make a reservation. It was a friendly clean environment. We had the Mother's Day cocktail (Yuzu vodka with strawberry's) and the English breakfast and the eggs Florentine and also sausage with eggs.. unfortunately I did not get a chance to take any photos since we all were hungry and we ate our food fast! The only item we did not enjoy was the fried chicken and waffles. The batter on the chicken was very dry and hard to taste. The waffles had aged cheddar which was a great flavor with the maple syrup but we were disappointed by the breading of the chicken! However this is a spot I will definitely be revisiting again. They had a great spot with sofas to sit and read and amazing bar!

SgdQjMZdc9mJRgsQeOz4YQ.text: This is such a cute place and they offer a delicious brunch. We arrived just when they opened and they were welcoming and friendly. The restaurant is clean and nicely decorated with original art on the wall. Books stock a low bookshelf if you'd like to read over coffee. The menu is varied and offers something for everyone. The servings were substantial and everything we had was delicious. My family each ordered a mimosa or other breakfast cocktail and they were good size. I had their coffee which was good, not the best I've had, but it was refilled often and it was hot.  We had a little mix up with the bill but they fixed it quickly with a smile. The staff are the kind of people that you'd want to be friends with. I'm from out of town but will definitely visit again when I'm back.

fvm-l5d6BcL3jwp_4VA26Q.text: This is such a nice little charming place! Food was great and exceeded my expectations! Reservations are a must.

Qgg_ate1bkAe-AiLaY_uTg.text: We really enjoyed our meal here.  Two of our party ordered the ribeye and said it was outstanding.  My husband ordered the pork belly, and it disappeared as well!   Staff exceptionally friendly.

yoMpJFxikThEE-PRE2NoFw.text: Our brunch experience this morning was, in a word, mediocre. We were seated quickly, but the waitress hardly said anything to us. We ordered our meals, and of course they were out of French toast which is the reason we came here. I got the bread pudding instead, and it was fine, nothing spectacular. My husband had the pork belly Benedict and he enjoyed it. The waitress seemed like she'd rather be anywhere else but here, and our meal seemed very rushed. Overall, it was pretty pricy for slightly above average food and and below average service.

tyEsL0q_3FYe8B7hb15AnA.text: Easter Sunday , we were in our way to Phoenix airport but wanted to find a restaurant close by to have brunch and were very lucky to find this place . We didn't have reservations but even though it was a busy weekend the staff was able to find us a table for two . We both had the full American breakfast and mimosas and at first I thought it was too much food but I wasn't able leave any . It was delicious, tasty and great combination of foods . the staff was very attentive, the place I found to be very cozy and homie , love the music , the ambience very delightful we truly enjoyed our Easter brunch

U27cP1cgqfk57I-J3-e3TQ.text: Loved the egg Florentine and the French toast! This place looks very plain on the outside but has such a hip look inside. I live all the artwork inside. Very homey and hip at the same time and the two items we ordered we're delicious!

UZclqWycsuDhmpbpWUsjTw.text: Fantastic meal in a cozy venue.  Tuck Shop looks like a small house, with an actual living room with couches as a waiting area.  We ate at the bar and enjoyed our meal from start to finish.  The gin & tonic (house-made tonic) is the best I've ever had, and I've had a lot.  The bartender was great - friendly and attentive.   Overall, a really warm and comfortable environment.

kEZxnxBkPOT3pANuFWjQzw.text: The Tuck Shop was recommended to me by a very well-informed bartender that I met months back.  I've been slowly working my way through the list he gave me.  Thus far, everything he advised I try has been good.  Thanks Chris!  This is yet another hidden gem in Phoenix.  In this case, quite literally.  I was supposed to meet a friend here for dinner and she drove past it twice trying to find it.  Maybe it has something to do with a lack of directional ability.  I'm not one to judge.  As soon as you enter, you get the strong feeling of comfort and welcome.  I think they do a lot to make the place feel big and inviting.  We sat down to wait for a table to become free, perused the menu, and chatted happily with the other people sitting around in the lounge-type waiting area.  By the time our table became free, we were pretty much set to order.  Strange as it seemed, the wait didn't really seem bothersome.  The server gave us the whole speech that first-timers get (I guess some people still don't understand the shared-plate concept) and we were off.  We ordered a plate from each section (small, large, and starter) all to share and they timed them all well.  Nothing really overlapped too much.  It gave us time to talk and eat without feeling rushed (speed food is a pet peeve of mine, usually).  The best plate was the pulled pork sandwich, a special that is offered seasonally.  I've only recently begun to eat pork again and for this, I'm glad I did.  The meat was so smooth as to nearly melt in with the sweet and savory barbecue sauce they used.  The potato bread roll had just the right consistency of fluff and resilience to hold up the the onslaught of sauce and meat.  Mind you, we still made a mess of ourselves, but we had great time doing so.  Happily, everything leading up to that was pretty amazing too.

uhjg3WOurY4W1lOfTWhngA.text: I tucking love this place!   My dining companion had been talking up the Tuck for a month before we finally got the opportunity to check it out. Nestled in a converted home in Phoenix's historic Coronado district the ambiance is relaxed yet upscale. But to be honest I had worked myself up into such a frenzy of culinary anticipation I wouldn't have cared if it was located behind a Food City in Apache Junction.   The staff was incredibly friendly but they picked up on the first date vibe we were putting out and kept their distance. The only exception was when I spazzed out and knocked a glass votive off the wall, shattering it. The place went radio silent, then several staff came over, whisked away the mess, and checked to make sure nobody was bleeding. They didn't make me feel like a jackass...not even a little bit.   They also didn't make me feel like a jackass when we ordered enough food for about five people and inhaled every last bite. Here are the scintillating details:   -Cheese Curds - Lightly battered, melty and delicious. No they don't come with sauce! THEY DON'T NEED SAUCE!  -Chorizo Stuffed Dates - Sweet, salty, spicy fiesta in my mouth. Who knew a hot date could be so delicious?! Incredibly simple yet amazing...  -Baby Lettuce Salad - This was so refreshing and light and the flavors were spot on. The crunch of the fennel was perfect with the buttery avocado. I wish I were eating it right now.  -Rosemary Goat Cheese Bruschetta - This was the most unremarkable item we ordered, but still really good. The rosemary and goat cheese paired nicely together and the ingredients were really fresh.  - Lobster Mac and Cheese - Homemade mac and cheese with lobster. No surprises here (unless you count prosciutto), just pure deliciousness.  -Catfish Cakes - So simple yet perfectly executed. The cakes were crispy on the outside and firm on the inside. They had a nice garlic flavor without overshadowing the rest of the ingredients. The quinoa and spinach side was awesome but I was really laser focused on those cakes.   Tuck Shop kind of personifies the man who took me there. Classy, not pretentious. Timelessly stylish, not trendy. The finest quality, freshest ingredients are meticulously constructed into dishes that are new and exciting yet evocative of the very familiar. Definitely a new favorite and will be for years to come!

yaBO7QnMmN5jS93WAzsl4Q.text: Bomb sauce. I have been anticipating this place since I was told they serve chicken and waffles. But don't go here expecting soul food like Mama used to make. This place is modern and cool. You won't have grease stains on a paper plate. Rather you will have a delectable meal that is finger-lickin' good.  I read a lot of reviews of this place before I darkened their doorway. So, kudos to you previous reviewers for suggesting the mac and cheese. That was bomb. Then I ordered the chicken and waffles. I was instantaneously in heaven. The only knock to the whole meal was the braised greens. I have had better, but that doesn't lower my score because they are inferior anyway to the brilliance that sat on the plate beside them.   Also, the wait staff was extremely helpful and patient. Since we sat at the bar near the kitchen, they let us see everything as it come out and were more than happy to tell us what each dish was.   The decor is very modern and appealing. They have gone to great lengths to make sure you know that this place is hip and with it.   I can't say much more other than, you must try this place. You must quit what you are doing right now and go. Drop the pen. Step away from the keyboard. Get up. Put on pants. Go eat at Tuck Shop. Wow- as I wrote that I realized that is a good schedule for my day...

esf1J9_LjLFEL5r6eF2qLQ.text: I was jazzed to eat here, but saw a negative review by a fellow Yelper and thought "hmmmm....."  But that guy must have been in a bad mood because I loved it!  I went with 4 friends last Friday for dinner and none of us was disappointed right from the start.  The Tuck Shop is quite literally a shop tucked into the Coronado neighborhood in a quaint brick building.  The inside is reminiscent of  a ski lodge with the decorative wood ceiling runner and cozy lounge that is perfect for enjoying a glass of wine while you wait for a table - and you will wait if you go during peak dinner times on a weekend as the dining room is small.  The plates are designed for sharing, but are still relatively small.  That does however lend diners the chance to enjoy a few apps with friends and still have room to enjoy a solo meal.  We started with the fancy cheese sticks - yum - that come with some sort of a pear dipping sauce.  Interesting....and delicious!  We also enjoyed the grilled baguette with roasted garlic which was a creamy surprise.  The beers are brewed for the Tuck Shop by Four Peaks which was a great treat and all of us enjoyed both flavors.  That was a nice addition to the start of our meal.  We all must have similar palates because we didn't vary much in our meal choices.  Three had the Times Mac & Cheese w/ Lobsta and two enjoyed the skirt steak.  Both were delicious.  I am a huge mac & cheese fan and I really enjoyed this version.  It was creamy and flavorful and the lobster was a surprising and welcome addition!  For dessert we enjoyed the baked apple, and by "we" I mean "I enjoyed" as I mowed it before most of my friends had a chance!  It was the perfect light dessert for a great, and well portioned, meal.  Plus, my friends were all so happy with the chocolate covered cookie dough balls they were happy to leave me be.  We will certainly be back and I'm looking forward to it.

ZsPf90YhUKmkxnguPZOEHw.text: Goodness...dusting myself off and getting a few squirts of oil before I get started. Oh Yelp, how I have missed you...  In my new quest to schlep my self through as many new dining spots as possible, I was fortunate enough to receive an invite to Tuck Shop from a great co-worker. Aside from the multiple attempts to get the name right prepare yourself for at least one phonetic faux pas on the phone with friends...  You are welomed with a small sign made of kids' blocks...so you know that you are in for a treat. It's like how I would love my house to be if I had a 50's-60's  ranch block. Decent sized bar, various seating arrangements and chair assortments with onr large table  in the middle and a cozy lounge area.   The chorizo stuffed dates with arugala were delish - so simple but the savory crispy chorizo with sweet gooey date and a little melted cheese on top peppered with a small bite of arugala just go so well together.  The mac and cheese was ok...needed salt and pepper and a little more moisture.   We ordered the chicken and white cheddar waffles - but we passed as they were out of  waffles. Instead we went with the red beans and rice with linquisa sausage and shrimp and the maple roasted pork tenderloin. The red beans and rice had amazing flavors with the spicey and sweet sausage with just a hint of cinnamon. Some of the beans were a little hard but it was easy to overlook because everything tasted so good. The pork was ok - the maple and mustard seed sauce was good...almost undercooked but juicy and great flavor. But I have to say the gorgonzola grits really turned me off...I kept thinking my old bikram yoga clothes were under the table or something. Maybe I'll try the grits next time sans stinky cheese.   And yes, the meal ended with tiny little cookie dough balls... Excellent service and tasty zingy gingerale.  I am so looking forward to trying the chicken!!!!

mybH5MJB-W4uO9DBwDrf1Q.text: The Tuck Shop is located in an out of the way neighborhood - in fact it's easy to miss. It has a nice homey atmosphere to it inside. The food overall was very good. By far our favorite apps were the Stuffed Medjool Dates and the Duck Tostada. Also tried the mac & cheese (good), cheese curds (average) and poutine (needed more flavor). For entrees we tried the Pine AZ Spiced Steak (excellent), their specials that night (also excellent), and the Pork T-Bone (the only miss of the night - the pork was a little too dry). Portions were good, we were all too full for dessert. Service was great, very attentive and good with suggestions. Overall really liked it and would definitely recommend a try.

fr4Ou6IDZSdfjS-ltnYfAA.text: We have dined many times at Tuck Shop and had great meals and experiences each time, however, this review is specifically focused around a private party we held there recently.    My husband and I were celebrating our recent wedding with an intimate private party and dinner of about 36 guests.  We rented out the restaurant on a Sunday night (usually closed) and it was a great event from start to finish.  My husband and I both wanted a memorable night that neither one of us had to be too hands on in coordinating as we are both very busy.  Trust me on this, if you trust anyone, trust John.  From the moment I contacted John at Tuck Shop he was focused on bringing together a night that would be special, unique and hassle free for us.  The majority of our menu for the evening was customized, which was another special touch.  We gave John our favorite dishes and wine preferences (favorite dish, favorite wine, etc.) left the rest up to him.  It was definitely worth it as our guest raved about the food!  My 80 year old grandmother said it was the best food she has had at a wedding--how many weddings do you think she has been to in 80 years?--pretty impressive stuff. :)  It was one of those occasions you didn't believe would happen so flawlessly because it took so little effort on my part.  John must've thought I was crazy contacting him the day before "We are missing something right?"  He fielded my questions with patience and professionalism.  We were not missing anything!  It was an amazing evening, coordinated to the T, and I would recommend Tuck Shop for ANY private party.  Every person in our party of 36 had an amazing evening.  Tuck Shop was accommodating to whatever we could come up with, and it was a very memorable occasion for all. This is a great venue for any special event and I have no doubt we will be back there again in the future for a birthday or anniversary!!!

glEdq0-3-Fdq0jPDUxjnwg.text: I want to live here. Do you think they'd mind if I just sacked out on their couch? The atmosphere is so intimate and welcoming, I almost feel like they would be fine with it.  We went here for my birthday, and I fell in love. The decor, the food, the bathrooms...I loved every detail. We were warned by the waiter that the portions are huge, but apparently he has never seen me eat before because we cleaned our plates.   We started with the mac and cheese (cheesy, gooey, creamy heaven in noodle form), the medjool dates with brie and chorizo (smokysweetspicy little bites of sin), the roasted garlic with crostini (OK, there's not much you can do to elevated this one from other restaurants, but it was devoured) and wine.   For dinner, we shared the citrus-brined fried chicken with greens and cheddar waffles. Oh my goodness. That was some damn good chicken, Colonel.  The only complaint I had was that I was so stuffed from dinner that I couldn't even fathom the thought of dessert, a rarity for me.   Can't wait to go back.

4awxeXcpJhgd6MPlxM30Rg.text: Had a great evening at Tuck Shop.  Three of us shared everything.  Cheese curds were delicious, Stuffed Dates were outrageous.  We really enjoyed everything we ate, including the skirt steak and lobster mac n cheese.  Looking forward to going there again!

b17iEk_e58DCXfRHlpiegg.text: Aptly named!! It is tucked away and uniquely designed. The food is meant to be shared FORGET THAT right now, it's not enough, but GOOD. The best thing I found here was the H2O. They put slices of cucumbers in it and I found that really refreshing. I would give it another try for lunch maybe next week.

wlsNnBw7lWYNUb2pim_1ug.text: The significant other decided to whisk me away for a romantic Valentimes Day dinner upon my arrival in PHX, and Tuck Shop was a pretty fabulous choice.  The modern architecture and design of the place manage to open in up, but the decor and the layout keep it cozy. As long as they had a bottle of wine under $30, I would have gave the place 3 stars on the ambiance alone. Our server that night also happened to be top notch.  On the ball, helpful and cool.  That can really make an experience.  The food I wasn't totally in love with.  I had the skirt steak.  It was over done and a tad salty for me.  It wasn't bad, I was just expecting more for what we were paying.  The french fries appetizer was delicious, so I'm willing to concede that maybe I had a bad throw of the dice.  It happens.  All in all, the Tuck is a great place for a romantic dinner, and I could see stopping in for drinks when you're looking for more than a tavern.

7hWGoChzzj0DWeBNlaY1tg.text: I heart you in every way possible..was it because my 1st meal, after a 60 day 500 calorie a day diet , that  I had mac and cheese with lobtsaaaa? No, it was that walking in, you captured  a small part of my heart and soul ...The experience made me feel that's it's ok to be happy in this economy and ok to pay for great food and service, and that the artsy fartsy table looking your way ..just doesn' t get you, but you don't care.  Tuck you R it! Thank you...plz don't abuse my very fave new spot of ALL time other than Back Street Wine Bar....their dog rocks! The cat ouside at Tuck...super sweet...anyhow...thank you for helping me enjoy food again and want to actually recommend clients and friends..Simplicity and comfort Chaz..this is the spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

wTudSKpQ-w0CEESp95GuRg.text: Been to this place a couple times and I can not really complain about it...good ambience, service, and food. However, this is the kind of place you go to before you go to bed because that is how you are going to feel after dinner here!!  Its comfort food, which is aways good.  Some stand outs are the cheese plate and of course the chicken and waffles. Some of the other dishes I have tried tend to be on the salty side and a little unbalance, flavor profile wise. Its not great food, but good....so why the 4 stars.  If you the guts to open a restaurant in a residential neighborhood, especially in that neighborhood and able to turn a residential house into architector's dream and serving decent food..you deserve 4 stars in my book:)

25-timVtsu21WnrJEgWbGg.text: After reading these reviews, I was highly anticipating my visit to the Tuck Shop.  Since I live in the same neighborhood, it already had my seal of approval before I sat down.  Unfortunately, as the evening progressed, the meal continually regressed.  The portions were small and overpriced. The food was poor.  In general, I was disappointed.  The patatas bravas were glorified french fries - I was extremely disappointed with these.  Yes, the mac and cheese was delicious.  I would gladly order this again.  However, as mentioned by other reviewers, the bowl of mac and cheese is small and definitely not large enough to feed two.  Finally, the halibut tasted pretty good but slightly over-cooked.    Perhaps I just ordered the wrong items, but I am in no hurry to return.

Lq-xcaiFM96RBczCYJjkqQ.text: Tuck Shop is rad. The food is great. Laura the bartender is amazing and John the GM is pretty freakin' cool too. The Happy Hour is great with Four Peaks beer specials and my absolute favorite cocktail, the Vivian Ward (named after the famous hooker Julia Roberts played in Pretty Woman). You have to try this place if you're downtown, or anywhere for that matter. Don't miss it.

n71uvz0KRs5hSrRUWWAcPg.text: Love this place. Very unexpected find in the middle of a neighborhood!  Don't miss the cheese curds and yummy brussel sprouts!

SrZSYXMBpGo0V5MU1e3ADQ.text: The food was absolutely wonderful. The owner John introduced himself, and treated us to gin and Tonics (his recipe for tonic)...what a treat. I had the hangar steak, and the mac and cheese.   I am so excited to have found such a wonderful neighborhood treat just down the street from us.

nT-cl09-Wc8OGlFMVzGoFg.text: First it was a specail night but we wanter to go someplace new.. Remember hearing the place... but Thought it was called Truck stop... many after many Google and yelp minutes used on my cell phone got nothing... then a round of txted got us the Adress...  the Night being great its always hard to remove that from the Equation... but for now I just love this place...well woth the Cell phone bill...  untill I investigate more...  v

x2mWeOofrEKIBDpzKDcTOA.text: Quaint. Comfortable. Homey.   When I first walked in and looked at the Reading Room, Tuck Shop reminded me of being in someone else's home in 1960.  I loved it!  There was a group of 5 of us, they only take reservations for 6 or more so we went earlier than later to ensure a spot.  5:30-- PERFECT.  After work and ready to try some supper.      The server made it sound as if the larger plates were so huge and they weren't really that big.  Between 5 of us we ordered: Panko crusted Walnut Fontina Cheese Dates stuffed with Sausage Times Mac n cheese (minus lobstah) Fish n CHips (special) Fried Chicken and Waffles (with the worst tasting greens in the world) Coriander Pork Loin  Not too shabby-- we each ordered either a cocktail or a Coca Cola Light (from Mexico-- love the bottles and that it's called Light, not Diet)- came out to $27/person plus tip.  That is good!  My only complaint, was that there was 5 of us and we asked if we could order one more sausage stuffed date (that doesn't sound right), so we could each have one and the server told us "the chef doesn't do that."  That's okay, one gal didn't want one anyway.   Tuck Shop's food is homey-- I like it.    The bar isn't fully stocked but, they have the basics.  I feel like I was there for the food anyway.

zVZQ2VYj5sD-uER76JjYtg.text: I meant to write this review a month ago when we went to Tuck for the first time.  We have lived in this neighborhood for over a year and never been. I never even noticed the place even though it is across from Sunshine Market, our favorite go to for craft beer specials.  We were celebrating my boyfriend's new job. He called and made a reservation which we discovered wasn't really necessary on the Wednesday evening that we went.  It was early and there was only one other party there. So there were all of these open tables but we were placed against the wall between an office and some other door. It was awkward. I didn't like that.  But the cocktails and the drinks...oh my. Wow. Incredible. I think everything we ordered was a special dish. We had a Brussels sprout and bacon appetizer that had perfect char but tender and oh so buttery.  My man had the lamb shank which he devoured and proclaimed it to be "so damn good!" I had these wonderful seared scallops with a mixed greens salad. I like my scallops with a really crunchy crust from the sear and these were golden and tasty but not as crunchy as I would've liked. But I am picky. The whole dish was sprinkled with little tiny golden chips. I asked the server and she told me they were roasted pear chips!! Are you kidding me? So clever and so delicious.  We shared a creme brulee for dessert. That was perfect. Perfect golden torched sugar crust and this lightly sweet cream underneath. Incredible. Just divine.  It is a little pricey though but definitely worth checking out again on another special occasion just to try the regular menu items. And get a better table.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Boyfriend&#39;s lamb and my bacon wrapped seared scallops. YUM

hnR1p-jK2k-U-Y_LdRiDBw.text: First I'll say I have been lusting and I mean LUSTING after this place since September. I don't know what took me so long to dine here but lucky for me my boyfriend took me out for a little romantic date Thursday night and TUCK SHOP was the spot.  I'm just going to make this quick. The food wasn't bad at all but I think I hyped it up a little too much in my head and it fell short of my expectations. I will add that dining here is more than just eating, it's about the art of the preparation and the beauty of the flavors. Just by reading the menu I could tell that so much time, effort and thought went into creating each dish. I'm still very glad I finally made my way out here and I would love to return and try the steak!

l_vDIpLj4YSJGB_E-SKX8Q.text: This place is racist. We made reservations for 7:30 got there at 7:20 and were told our table wasn't ready yet. While waiting 2 other white couples walked in and got seated immediately. By this time it's 7:40. Still no one has seated us. Another 3rd white couple walked in got seated right away. I got up and asked and again was told our seats were ready. We ended up just walking out. Very sad to experience such open racism.

l5qblLuI-z4Qt3yrND3bZA.text: Absolutely amazing experience: let's break it down.. ambiance, food, service.  Ambiance: This is a converted house that has some individual tables and then has some more family style tables. It has a partially open kitchen and a quaint little bar. There is a waiting area that somewhat mirrors and adult play pen or nursery (yes the adult kind).. Games, books, comfy chairs. So if you are waiting to be seated, you can camp out there. It's actually kinda cool.  Food - absolute deliciousness. Starters: Cheese Curds and Grilled Baguette; Smaller Plates: Goat Cheese Salad, Mac n Cheese; For Sharing: Veggie and Ricotta Ravioli, Chicken and Waffles, Spiced Steak, and Salmon and Shrimp Cakes. Surprisingly, I thoroughly enjoyed the veggie and ricotta ravioli the most. I then enjoyed the cheese curds and the baguette.. they smokey dip served with it was AMAZING.  Service - our waiter was a gem. Had an opinion about the menu, offered suggestions, checked on us at regular enough intervals. It was awesome. I believe the thing that made the experience the best was how they accommodated our group without reservations and were honest with us to say that we could be sat as long as we were finished within 2 hours because their was a reservation at our table. I thought that was awesome because they could have easily said "full house".. I've been to some places like that.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mahi mahi

rWGEGftwicH0O8TKpKzcnA.text: I am not liberal with my 5 stars but this was one of the most amazing and unique little places that I have been to in the area.   I have been trying so many new places between uptown,  midtown,  downtown and this is a hidden gem.  Tucked away on 12th St and Oak,  with a warm and cozy living room inside is this neighborhood gem.  We shared the perfectly roasted brussel sprouts on a bed of polenta and practically licked the plate.   The lobstah mac not cheese was perfect as well as the chicken and waffles.   Topped it off with creme brulee and you can roll me out the door.   Full bar,  great atmosphere,  good blues playing in the background.   Seriously,  I can't wait to go back.

YpdMVcQCdfgGSp44GVO5Wg.text: I give places 5 stars because they deserve it, and the rest I don't spend as much time on a review. This place I had to review because it is so amazing. Food is great, the staff will become your best friend and they mid century style is SO COOL! Awesome find you need to take your friends here.

kgo6oo8BaQkEoPwMR3FbtA.text: With such an unassuming exterior and location, I'm glad I checked the yelp reviews. Inside was a cozy and cute atmosphere; it wasn't too loud or crowded. The food was EXCELLENT! We had a group of 8. We tried the charcuterie board, roasted garlic, lobstah mac n cheese, shrimp piri piri, someone had a salad, streak n frites, and the shrimp special. I can't remember the rest, but it was all good!

XlvYpyaAY_H_yT8DQngbHA.text: We love Tuck Shop! Always a great experience. The chicken and waffles and mac and cheese are phenomenal.

-1agZ-qgCa_zQfL7opT_5g.text: I was given a gift card for my birthday back in August but I have not been back to Tuck Shop. I really don't like this new "ticket" approach to reservations, especially considering that I can't apply my gift card to that price.   We are going to try and walk in tonight and see if we can get a seat without the reservation. I've done the ticketing concept at restaurants in LA but Tuck is a small place, this approach seems a bit pretentious. I'd be curious to hear what others think. Deducting a star for this hassle but that can change if we get in tonight.

vc_wWYqyh6A-OmYy-jW7rA.text: Amazing as always! No one beats the quality of food and drinks! Thank you yet again!!!!

a93whu__ExF8KEnUUUZ_LA.text: It was our go to happy spot before the new owners.  Tried our favorites twice since new owners...and left the chicken on the plate from chicken and waffles.  Is it the food quality?  Can't tell, but literally leaving hungry and going somewhere else afterwards.  Why pay for two meals when the first is inedible?  Disappointing regardless.    Ps, waffles are fine both times.  Green beans are no longer spicy (black pepper quality varies).  We just sigh now, wishing we had our Tuck Shop back.

Hfyr4vTllNg80YZykBwgyQ.text: The restaurant is tucked away in a neighborhood on the outskirts of downtown phoenix. The parking lot is small but I believe there to be plenty of street parking surrounding it.   The sign was the first thing that caught my eye. Made with colorful toy blocks that made me smile as I entered the restaurant. It is a dainty and intimate restaurant for perfect for a chill evening out with a significant other or friend. My friend and I sat down and decided to order the mac and cheese, taco salad and bbq beef ribs to share. The salad was delicious with the portion being bigger than we both expected. The mac and cheese was good at first but we both figured it to be a little too heavy and salty for our taste. By the time the ribs came out though, we barely had room left in our stomachs. Ended up shairing one rack (4 ribs) between the two of us and packed the rest to go.   I thought the service was okay for how not busy the restaurant was and would prefer to taste more from the kitchen before giving it an extra star. Definitely enjoyed our time there, however, and wouldnt mind going back!

_lG5hTw4MEnTATdxBGQz-A.text: Unbelievable!  Gluten free awesomeness with tons of flavor.  I ordered the AZ spiced steak with mushroom and a big juicy red Shiraz.  What great flavor!  Jenny was my waitress and knew the deal I wanted.  Again can't go wrong here chicken seafood or steak it all looked great with quick professional service! Get some!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. AZ spiced steak awesome and Shiraz.  Good livin!

hAZ8G-mdSbNRYPRJD3fqqA.text: Drinks were good. Service was good. Items on bread board good but skimpy on some items. not as good as other places . The waffles were good but cheese does not replace maple syrup. The chicken was ok but was not something I would go back for considering all factors. Happy Hour should be all days and include weekends (not just at bar or lounge).   One of the owners, Grace, contacted me regarding this review and discussed the issues I presented. Syrup was available and could have been given. We did not ask as we thought this was not included. She will look into the matter of skimpy amount of items on the bread board. I was informed that I could have been given options of parts of the chicken as they are cut into parts . Perhaps the server was unaware of this option. The website should state that happy hour on Weekends is only at the bar or lounge. I do appreciate the contact and investment, interest the owner has in customers...and looks for input for quality assurance and improvements. There are many options for restaurant choices thus this is an important issue. We like to support local vendors. Its a cute and enjoyable place. Happy hour every day please. more clarity on menu and personalizing choices.

RbyCJVUPpLczdPOFGcBItA.text: Food was outstanding.  I tried the cheese curds, the Brussels sprouts, the beet ravioli - all amazing!  With that said, if you actually want to get full - make sure you order a 'large plate' haha.  the appetizers and small plates are just that - small, as in tiny.. as in not a full meal.  And for $11-16 you'd be sad to not be full -(my bill with tax and tip came to $19 for 4 ravioli and coffee) so spend the extra money and get yourself a large meal (you'll thank me).  But, the quality of the food was beyond excellent and extremely appealing to the eye as well.  A very cute place, snuggled in a neighborhood, great atmosphere, and really sweet waitress!  I will come again, but next time - it's gonna be chicken and waffles for me!!

dttEHQxTVCyp5KcMyA9c8g.text: I'm a fan of any place with Tito's as their  "well" vodka. In fact, that's the ONLY vodka they pour! Whoo-hoo! Another nice touch was their house made mixers (tonic, ginger ale, sour mix & lemonade).   Tuck Shop is a tiny old house converted to a local gem. It's tucked away (pardon the pun) in a Central Phoenix neighborhood and you'll drive by and miss it if you're not paying attention.   We started with a Tito's and house made ginger ale chorizo stuffed Medjool dates for appetizer. The sweet & savory experience was unexpected and very delightful. I almost ate the entire app alone!   For dinner, I ordered the citrus-brined chicken and white cheddar waffles. It's served with spicy grilled string beans. The chicken was juicy and tender and the waffles were surprisingly different. The one thing missing for me was syrup. I asked my server about it. He said the chef wanted to go with more of a dinner dish and that syrup would have been too breakfast-y. Au contraire mon frere!!!! Maple based syrup is part of the the complexity of the dish! Chef could have figured out something a savory syrup recipe! And franky, without it, the dish was on the dry side.   My friend had the Catfish & Crawfish w/ polenta. I didn't try it, but the plate was pretty darn clean!   Enjoy!

1eOBm5NjlIqVd6fhp8ieAw.text: I'm sure the food is great, I'm sure the service is great. Why the one-star review? They didn't have a highchair. I'm sorry if this comes across as entitled, but I didn't see a big sign on the door saying children not welcome, but by choosing not to purchase a $50 highchair, that's exactly what you're saying.  We planned to have dinner with our well behaved, non-vomiting, non-screaming one-year-old, but by sending that very clear message that we are not welcome, guess what, we left and went somewhere else.

zXLLiQtEmL16xMxxmVFi_Q.text: Outstanding! The beet ravioli was amazing! Great service. I was fawned over.  Adorbs house. This might be my new favorite restaurant.

YXIh8Gv508V1xCO05iqkxA.text: Easily my favorite restaurant in all of Phoenix.  The staff is always friendly, food is always perfect and the cocktails are creative and boozy.

ZU14s4BlJehU5zsbgR-URQ.text: If you want to impress a date or visitors, then this is where you go. The tiny house nestled in an unsuspecting neighborhood is cute and adds to the entire vibe.  Reservations are the smartest way to go, but if you're just with one person then the bar is more than fine. The reservation system is different (you pay $25 a spot) but it all goes towards your bill and they add on tip. So, really not that weird in the end.  The food is amazing. My favorite entrees are the chicken and waffles and the steak. The waffles are much more savory than sweet and the chicken is super crispy and juicy. They cycle in and out new dishes every few months. I try to force myself to go for new things, but always find myself coming back to the classics (lobster mac n' cheese).   My suggestion is go with people who are cool with ordering lots of small plates and a couple entrees and sharing. There's so many amazing dishes you will want to taste everything you can.

1dHiNp8mHOD0MLFOX459dA.text: Great little restaurant in the heart of Coronado.  The menu is incredible and the Bread Pudding is just something to remember  Friendly staff, clean establishment with plenty for of parking lot.  The perfect little restaurant for a romantic date. Also, they have the best brunch menu that includes their famous Croissant Bread Pudding

ypA4ksK1K5MUTQXr16XvJA.text: I'd been looking forward to going here for quiet a long time.  I've always found their food to be creative and delicious when I've seen them at various food festivals around the valley.  And the food mostly lived up to expectations.  We had a few of the small plates (the roasted garlic, the stuffed dates, the mac n cheese, the shrimp pati pati, and something else that wasn't memorable apparently).  The shrimp dish was delicious.  I could eat a home depot bucket full of that.  The full entrees that came out looked good as well (the chicken and waffles seemed to be a popular item to split).     The service was a bit overattentive but I won't knock that.  It's such a small place that it's hard for the server to not hover.    The cocktail list is interesting but they only had 4 beers on draft which was disappointing (since the weren't even good beers IMO). They had wine aplenty.    In the end I didn't find the value to be there.  Four small plates, a small app, and 1 drink ran nearly $100 after tax and tip.  It was good, it just wasn't worth it.

ljHGbx8LQehp-1c_x0cMbA.text: Hadn't been here in a while but boy was it ever so enjoyable! If you haven't been here, the menu changes seasonally - and if I can remember... quite often. So if you went and enjoyed something and wanted to go back to enjoy it again, you'd have to do it pretty close to the original visit or you may miss it forever.  The menu this time around was still unique and everything sounds so delicious. They have appetizers, small plates and large plates on the menu. My girlfriend and I shared one of each, some wine and dessert! The bottle prices are a little absurd- $70, $90+ and each glass is about $12-20 so our bill definitely added up quickly. But our server, Linda - provided excellent service, and the food was bursting with flavor. Their ingredients are different and from my knowledge local and so fresh.   We enjoyed the salad on the small plates - it was SO GOOD. The beet ravioli, which actually has no pasta in it at all - the beets act as the pasta (and this was absolutely delectable. And as our entree we had some dry rubbed steak with mushrooms and mashed potatoes... and this was absolute heaven in your mouth. We literally were licking our plates!  And the dessert guys... some raspberry bread pudding with fresh whip and whiskey sauce.... wow.   Overall, we spent a little over $100 for the two of us but we were well fed and beyond happy with our romantic and ultra divine dinner and experience. Definitely recommend for a quiet, romantic evening out with a good friend or a date. Not cheap but worth it.

Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The steak, mushrooms and mashed

aVfdzhKSKJhUAXpCWDU5rg.text: Probably one of the best restaurants I've tried in Phoenix. It's a nice to have a fun date night restaurant that isn't the usually steak houses. The cocktails are amazing too.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

obLiZQMDmO-_436Hme9W6A.text: This place is very chic! I loved the vibe and omg their smoked salmon is superb! I truly enjoyed eating here and can't wait to come back for a net meal!

Veylrf3Hve8BuJiF3ZT3Lg.text: Nice, warm and cute. Privately owned, not so big but tastes really good. Not so children friendly since they had a candle over the window where the restrooms are, my kid touched the candle while I was using the restroom, but other than that a great place, friendly waitress

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Rib eye

QPA0CcNRClcaiXSOCkEQZg.text: Food, Service, Atmosphere, Bar!!!  AMAZING.  This spot can be a place for a romantic dinner or to meet up with some friends for a drink and appetizers.

lJyIDvvAJXIRbu0stWU0Dg.text: Loved this place. The food was so good. I ordered steak and eggs. My potatoes were on point - not too soft, not too hard. Nothing was bland. I even ordered my steak to be well done and it was still juicy. My friend didn't like her fried chicken because she wasn't used to the coating but I loved everything on my plate. I didn't taste her chicken so I can't comment on that but for all the food she received, the price was definitely too good. The portions were good size. I'll def be coming here again. Service was wonderful. We had a baby with us and they were very accommodating. I need to find time to come back here again. I wish they were open on Monday mornings so I can take my husband there.

n8P-tl-Jfqd42JUEoqbIbQ.text: Wow this place is good.  It's a bit off the beaten path, but great food options.  Best bet is to get small plates to share so you can sample all of the unusual items on the menu (chicken and waffles, beat ravioli, cheese curds, etc.)

ipUqp3r3CK2iOEwIxWhW5w.text: I have lived in Phoenix my entire adult life and have never heard of Tuck Shop, I lived within a 10-mike radius and never heard of Tuck Shop. My loss.  We needed a date night, and we needed a GOOD ONE. This place delivered. The moment we were seated and the hostess started explaining the fresh, "from scratch" made cocktails I knew I was going to love this place. Cocktails are my weakness.  We started out with the Gin Gimlet and cheese curds with the crab ceviche and every single bite was nibbled. Our expectations were defeated, and the flavors had my taste buds dancin!  We split the St.Louis BBQ Ribs which came with horseradish coleslaw and a jalapeno cornbread muffin... pair the 3 together on your fork and you'll wanna slap ya momma! I left happy, full, not-ready-to-go and a feeling of "when can we come back??"  Do yourself a solid and make a reservation here for your next evening out!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

hktdW5hmX3mP99kNfsAMTw.text: We came in just under the wire for closing time and for our order in before 10:00.  I picked the pork tenderloin because it popped of the page in a rushed scan.  The staff is nice...but you can tell the would have been happier if they had locked up a couple minutes early and been able to go home.  We are the only people here.  The iced tea is nice.  A basket of bread would have been nice.  Everything seems al la Carte so no salad before the meal...  The food arrived in a reasonable time but it was nothing special.  The onion rings were not soggy but not crispy either.  The pork was "crunchy" and a bit more cooked than I like.  Not most, tender or juicy.  It would be interesting to see how things would have tasted if we had been in an hour earlier - but I am just not that motivated to come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

cV8eSuTnsBc-zNBQ7GqmNA.text: This was my second time at Tuck Shop and I love it! It's a cute restaurant with nice decor and ambiance and I've never had anything bad here. The staff is friendly and there's lots of parking and is easy to get a reservation. Menu is a fusion type and has lots of great options! They have an extensive drink and wine menu as well. Definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States

nkLOG_Dt-fj7b-nk0-_kDQ.text: Great restaurant in a cute house. Neighborhood gem. The food is amazing and they play eclectic music.

5emPHaOx1nl848PADadOzw.text: If you haven't been here.....  Quickly forgive yourself. NOW! Reconsider your decisions and come by.   You're welcome.

kyulE9eBC25R60AaF5tOQg.text: Tuck Shop is by far one of the best restaurants I have been to in the greater Phoenix area. I made reservations to drop by on a weeknight with a friend and was not disappointed in the least.   We parked in the lot across the street and just walked over and were seated pretty quickly. Service was great and we were able to put in appetizers and entrees at a good pace. The food also came out at appropriately spaced periods so I really enjoyed the dinner.   Now when we went in, we wanted to try like 10 things on the menu. We ended up ordering the cheese curds, gnocchi, portabello melt, and the chicken and waffles. First off the cheese curds were deeelicious! Perfectly salty and definitely one of the best appetizers ever. The gnocchi, which was pan fried, had an awesome flavor and I super recommend it. I personally loved the portabello melt which came with a side rice+corn salad type of thing that complimented it well. My friend who had the chicken and waffles seemed to enjoy it and I did love the small piece of waffle I tried as as well!   Overall, the food was great and service was really good. The interior is quaint, homey, and inviting which is always nice. I high recommend dropping by if you are in the mood for great food!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and waffles and portabello melt
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cheese curds
Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Gnocchi

n8V3tBSLoYrqJmURWY4RiA.text: Came here by chance. Was in town checking out Phoenix and this spot was close to the Air BNB we were staying at. The place is very quaint. The food was decent. The staff was very friendly. They made a mistake when billing my friend's tab that we didn't notice until the next day, and they were quick to fix it. I would definitely recommend this place!

x-Z-_fdYgAM2OEy7Ge99Lg.text: My friend and I had dinner here, on a busy Saturday night. We were greeted with a smile, and offered the bar to sit while we waited. We waited only a few minutes!!! Our server was at our table with waters, menus, and pad in hand to take our drink order and review the specials. She was very familiar with the menu, gave us her opinions of the different selections, and made wonderful recommendations. We had the roasted garlic, brussel sprouts, ribeye w/ a lemon butter, hand cut fries, and asparagus. It was cooked a perfect medium, per our request. Service was exceptional, food was delicious, portions were generous. Ingredients used were fresh, farm to table!!! Couldn't be more pleased with Tuck....their food, service and setting.

w1ZrsfhQgkEYBQK1_I5exA.text: I have been wanting to try Tuck Shop for quite a while. I had heard so many great things from my foodie friends. After trying it for myself, I must report that all those things were True! I loved it! We decided to do a tapas style dinner and order some of the smaller plates to share! We tried the brussels sprouts (amazing!), the carne tacos, and the mac and cheese! I'm normally not a huge mac and cheese fan, it's either too bland or too rich. But this is the goldilocks of mac and cheese...it was just right! I will absolutely be back...next time for brunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Tuck Shop - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu August 2018

rb9Eh9KW2bPqk3fV5gUZoA.text: I have been there many times as it is a staple in my neighborhood.    As a whole the food is good/very good and the space is charming.    The service, on the other hand, falls far short of what should be expected and seems to be getting worse.  Last week, all entrees came out at different times.   The prior visit, my reservations were lost.   Glasses constantly sit empty.   In the past 10 days I have stopped by 3 times to purchase a Gift Card.  As I was asked to return in 30 minutes for what would be my fourth visit, I left and thought why would I gift someone an unpleasant evening and headed to another option.   Everyone has been gracious and apologetic but there comes a time when apologizing after the fact doesn't matter.    For me, that time is now.   Beware of spending ur dinner dollars here

vAF6xEI2eh2ognk-cLpcMQ.text: Truly a hidden gem in Central Phoenix. Not sure where to start - the atmosphere, the menu, the drinks, the owners, the food... they are really all top of the food chain. We love eating here, where we feel at home both in the space and with the people. And the food... I don't think I've ever had anything here that wasn't among the best of that particular dish I've ever eaten. The drink menu is super creative and delicious, and the beer and wine selection are also wonderfully cultivated. Hey Yelp, can I please give Tuck Shop 6, 7, or 12 stars?

MjyH25kgjykHhXM-vCI3uA.text: If you don't come here you're stupid and probably don't deserve the great service and delicious food.

Wsop7KA1kfts3Ei0vVPUpw.text: This was not my first time there.....last time I had a much better meal.  I can't say that anything was really bad, but the portions were so small and the prices were rather steep considering the size of the portion.  I ended up going out a couple hours after dinner to another restaurant for an appetizer as I was still hungry.  There are too many restaurants in the area that are better and less expensive so this will probably be my last visit here for awhile.

BPVXHPss3qV-nJ-ytZ4jdQ.text: This is a great place. Everything for the most part tasted fresh and yummy.   Except I thought the catfish and crabcake dinner entree was too heavy and salty. It's not enough to deter me from coming back and trying something else though. 4.5 stars.

qVuXkdXxP-dWTUyJmqgIQw.text: Comfortable and familiar homey feeling.  Don't leave without trying the cheese curds.

1QTsSNPSqYP7e3pb6w31QA.text: Go and enjoy. Food was superb, service was excellent, Prices are reasonable and despite reviews to the contrary, portions are perfect. If you're looking for food that is piled ten feet high on a plate without regard to taste, the Cheesecake Factory is right up on Camelback.

JzAu14O9onNwgXmgbroU8A.text: Wowee my taste buds were so happy last night!!  The Tuck Shop calls their cuisine "neighborhood comfort food" and they are right in so many ways. The restaurant is located in a neighborhood. In fact, it looks like an old house and doesn't stand out at all except the small "Tuck Shop" neon on the west side of the building. Since it probably was a house at one time, its pretty small. I don't think I saw more than 10 tables. When we arrived, the very friendly host stated it could be up to 45 minutes for a table or at the bar. We stated we'd think about it and surveyed the people waiting and where the guests were at in their meals. The host returned to let us know that the guests at the tables were finishing up faster than he thought, let us know how many were ahead of us, and let us know we could enjoy some cocktails while we waited.  We ordered two vodka lemonades and they were awesome. The menu stated it was homemade lemonade and it was delicious. Not too sweet, not too sour, not too tart, and not too much alcohol. We maybe got 1/4 of the way through our drinks when the host returned to let us know there was room at the bar for us.  Our bartender/server was very friendly and attentive. We like to order a little of everything and share when we try a new restaurant in order to give an accurate recommendation or decide to return. From the starters, we ordered the herbed potato fries with Gruyere cheese and mushroom gravy; from small plates, we ordered times mac and cheese with crispy prosciutto and herbed breadcrumbs and added lobster; and from the sharing menu, we ordered the citrus-brined fried chicken with white cheddar waffles.  The fries were cut steak size and had the perfect balance of crispy outside and soft inside. The cheese had a surprising kick to it. The mushroom gravy was soooooooooo good and reminded me of what my grandma would make.  The mac and cheese was fantastic. I wasn't a fan of the lobster, but I'm not really a fan of lobster period. It was added to the top of it rather than mixed in. I recommend not adding the lobster; there's plenty of flavor with the breadcrumbs and prosciutto. A few bites into the mac and cheese, we started to get pretty full and our server actually asked us if we wanted to cancel the chicken and waffles. No way any other restaurant would cancel and extra sale. We told her to bring it out because we had to try it.  God I'm glad we did. The waffles were fluffy and sweet. The chicken was juicy and tender. It all went together so amazingly I couldn't stop myself from eating it.  I'm happy we got to try so many delicious dishes and look forward to our next visit when I'll only order one item in order to save room for dessert. The people next to us did and it looked phenomenal. We still got to indulge on chocolate chip cookie dough balls that were given to us, rather than mints, with our check.
